articles.title: US Launches Airstrikes on Iranian Nuclear Facilities
articles.description: The United States has conducted airstrikes on three of Iran's nuclear sites, stating the attacks caused "severe damage." This military intervention comes as the conflict between Israel and Iran enters its second week. In response to the US bombing, Iran launched a ballistic missile barrage at Israel. The Trump administration has signaled a willingness to engage in talks with Iran to prevent a prolonged war, while also receiving praise from Republicans in Congress for the strikes. World leaders have reacted with many calling for diplomacy.
articles.source: Multiple sources including Al Jazeera, Google News, AP News, and PBS News

articles.title: Belarus Frees Dissident Siarhei Tsikhanouski and Others
articles.description: Belarus has released prominent dissident Siarhei Tsikhanouski, the husband of exiled opposition leader Sviatlana Tsikhanouskaya, along with 13 other individuals. This move follows a rare visit to Minsk by a high-ranking US official. Tsikhanouski's release was confirmed by representatives of his wife on Saturday.
articles.source: The Times of India, AP News

articles.title: FedEx Founder Fred Smith Dies at 80
articles.description: Fred Smith, the founder of FedEx and a Marine Corps veteran who revolutionized the package delivery industry, has died at the age of 80. Smith's innovative approach to logistics and his leadership grew FedEx into a global powerhouse. His passing has been widely reported, marking the end of an era for the business world.

articles.title: US Launches Airstrikes on Iranian Nuclear Facilities
articles.description: The United States conducted airstrikes on three of Iran's nuclear facilities, with President Trump stating the sites were "totally obliterated". The full extent of the damage to Iran's nuclear program is still being assessed. The strikes have prompted a "worldwide" travel warning for Americans and have led several airlines to cancel flights to the Middle East.

articles.title: Iran Retaliates with Missile Strikes on Israel
articles.description: In response to the US airstrikes, Iran launched a barrage of missiles that struck northern and central Israel, wounding more than 20 people. The attacks caused significant explosions and have heightened fears of a wider regional conflict.
articles.source: Al Jazeera, Associated Press, CBS News

articles.title: International Condemnation and Calls for De-escalation Follow US Strikes
articles.description: The US airstrikes on Iran have drawn criticism from some, with Democratic lawmakers in the US questioning the constitutionality of the president's actions without congressional approval. Global leaders have expressed concern, with the UK's foreign secretary warning Iran against further retaliation. Meanwhile, the White House has indicated that President Trump is open to diplomacy with Iran, even as his administration's actions suggest a potential interest in regime change.
articles.source: Al Jazeera, Associated Press, Hindustan Times

articles.title: Trump says Iran-Israel ceasefire is in effect after both sides violated it.
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump announced that a "Complete and Total CEASEFIRE" is in effect between Israel and Iran, following a 12-day conflict. The agreement came after both sides reportedly launched missiles, with Iran targeting a U.S. base in Qatar and Israel conducting strikes in Iran. Both nations have publicly agreed to the ceasefire, which was proposed by the U.S.

articles.title: 145 people at France music festival report being pricked with syringes after online calls to target women.
articles.description: During France's annual FÃªte de la Musique, 145 people reported being pricked with syringes. The incidents occurred amidst "unprecedented crowds" and followed social media calls to target women. Authorities have detained 12 suspects, and it is currently unclear if the needles contained any drugs.

articles.title: Supreme Court allows Trump to restart swift deportation of migrants to locations that are not their home countries.
articles.description: The U.S. Supreme Court has lifted a lower court's order, allowing the Trump administration to resume the rapid deportation of migrants to countries where they have no previous ties. The ruling, which saw the court's three liberal justices dissent, gives officials more flexibility in carrying out mass deportations, particularly when a migrant's home country is resistant to their return.

articles.title: Fragile ceasefire appears to hold between Iran and Israel as Trump vents frustration with both sides
articles.description: A fragile ceasefire between Iran and Israel appears to be holding, following a period of intense conflict. Former U.S. President Donald Trump has publicly expressed his frustration with both nations. The situation remains tense, with the international community closely monitoring the stability of the truce.

articles.title: Air India to cut 38 international flights per week; suspends services on 3 overseas routes
articles.description: Air India has announced a significant reduction in its international flight schedule, cutting 38 flights per week and suspending services on three overseas routes. This move is part of the airline's operational adjustments.

articles.title: Israel-Iran truce holds; Intel reports say US did not destroy nuclear sites
articles.description: A truce between Israel and Iran is currently holding. Intelligence reports suggest that recent US actions did not result in the destruction of Iran's nuclear facilities. This development comes amid a volatile period in the region.

articles.title: Intel leaders say new intelligence shows Iran's nuclear sites could take "years" to rebuild.
articles.description: Following U.S. airstrikes on three of Iran's nuclear facilities, conflicting reports have emerged regarding the extent of the damage. An initial assessment from the Defense Intelligence Agency suggested that Tehran's nuclear program might only be set back by a few months. However, the heads of the CIA and the Director of National Intelligence have since stated that new intelligence indicates the damage is "severely damaged" and could take "years" to rebuild. The White House has firmly supported the view of a significant setback for Iran's nuclear ambitions, with President Trump stating the facilities were "obliterated". In a press conference, Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth defended the success of the strikes, dubbed "Operation Midnight Hammer," and criticized media coverage of the initial, less optimistic intelligence assessments.

articles.title: Starmer in crisis talks over changes to welfare bill as he attempts to stave off MPs' rebellion.
articles.description: U.K. Prime Minister Keir Starmer is facing a significant rebellion from within his own Labour Party over proposed cuts to disability and sickness benefits. More than 120 Labour MPs have signed an amendment that could halt the legislation, expressing concerns that the changes have not been properly scrutinized and could push a quarter of a million more people into poverty. In response to the growing mutiny, the government has entered into "conversations" with the rebels, signaling potential changes to the welfare reform bill. This marks a shift in tone from the government's initial firm stance and comes as some former Labour figures warn of a "humiliating" no-confidence vote if the rebellion is not addressed.

articles.title: 3 dead and a dozen missing as torrential rains cause flash flood in north India.
articles.description: At least three people have died and around a dozen are missing after torrential rains triggered a flash flood in the northern Indian state of Himachal Pradesh. A rescue operation is underway to find the missing individuals, many of whom were workers at a hydroelectric power project who were swept away when water levels rose suddenly. The region has been experiencing a severe heatwave, which is now being followed by heavy rainfall, leading to dangerous conditions. Authorities have evacuated dozens of stranded tourists and have issued warnings for more rain, which could lead to further flash floods, landslides, and a rise in river levels. This event highlights the growing concerns about extreme weather events in Asia, which the World Meteorological Organization says is heating up almost twice as fast as the global average.

articles.title: Supreme Court curbs injunctions that blocked Trump's birthright citizenship plan.
articles.description: The Supreme Court issued a ruling that limits the power of federal judges to issue nationwide injunctions. This decision directly impacts the executive order that sought to deny birthright citizenship to the U.S.-born children of non-citizens and has wide-ranging implications for future legal challenges to presidential policies.

articles.title: U.S. and China formalize deal on rare earth shipments in trade breakthrough.
articles.description: The United States and China have formally reached a trade agreement regarding the shipment of rare earth minerals. This deal marks a significant development in the trade relations between the two economic giants.

articles.title: Israel kills 72 in latest Gaza strikes as 549 aid seekers killed in a month
articles.description: In the past 24 hours, Israeli strikes in Gaza have resulted in the deaths of 72 Palestinians, according to the local Ministry of Health. This comes as reports indicate that 549 people seeking aid have been killed in the last month, highlighting the dangers faced by civilians at aid distribution sites.

articles.title: Hundreds of Thousands Mourn Iranian Commanders and Scientists in Tehran
articles.description: Hundreds of thousands of people gathered in Tehran for the state funeral of top Iranian military commanders and scientists who were killed in Israeli strikes. The ceremony marked a significant national event, drawing large crowds and international attention.

articles.title: Supreme Court Hands Trump 'GIANT WIN' in Birthright Citizenship Case
articles.description: The Supreme Court issued a ruling that limits the use of universal injunctions by lower courts, a decision praised by former President Trump. The case specifically addressed birthright citizenship and has significant implications for presidential authority and immigration policy.

articles.title: Russian Drones Kill 2 and Injure 17 in Odesa
articles.description: A Russian drone strike on the southern Ukrainian port city of Odesa resulted in the deaths of two people and left 17 others injured. The attack is part of the ongoing conflict and highlights the continued violence in the region.

articles.title: Senate Republicans Advance Trump's "Big, Beautiful Bill"
articles.description: Senate Republicans have voted to advance a major tax and spending cuts bill, often referred to by former President Donald Trump as the "big, beautiful bill". The bill's passage through this key hurdle in the Senate marks a significant step in a renewed push for substantial fiscal changes. The contents and potential impacts of this legislation are currently a major focus of political debate in the U.S.
articles.source: The Times of India, Associated Press

articles.title: Kolkata Law College Student Allegedly Raped by Seniors
articles.description: A 24-year-old female student at South Calcutta Law College was allegedly raped by two senior students and one alumnus inside the college's guard room. The incident has sparked outrage, with CCTV footage reportedly confirming the student's allegations. Trinamool Congress leader Mahua Moitra has condemned remarks made by some of her party colleagues regarding the case as "misogyny". The prime accused has been noted for his disturbing behavior towards other female students.

articles.title: Hundreds of Thousands Mourn Iranian Commanders as Israeli Strikes on Gaza Continue
articles.description: Large crowds gathered in Iran for the state funeral of top military commanders and scientists who were recently killed in strikes attributed to Israel. This comes as Israeli strikes on the Gaza Strip have resulted in the deaths of at least 72 people. Amid the ongoing conflict, UNICEF has reported an "alarming rate" of rising malnutrition among children in Gaza, with at least 66 deaths from malnutrition confirmed.

articles.title: 2 firefighters killed in ambush in Idaho, shot at while responding to wildfire, sheriff says
articles.description: Two firefighters were killed and a third was wounded in an ambush in Idaho. Authorities report that the firefighters were responding to a wildfire when they were shot at. The suspected gunman, who is believed to have started the fire to lure the first responders, was later found dead.

articles.title: Diddy trial live: Jury set to begin deliberations as Sean Combs braces for verdict in sex-trafficking case
articles.description: The jury has begun deliberations in the sex-trafficking and racketeering trial of music mogul Sean 'Diddy' Combs. Combs faces multiple charges, including racketeering conspiracy and sex trafficking, and could face life in prison if convicted. The trial has featured weeks of testimony from various witnesses.

articles.title: Senate begins marathon vote series on Trump's "big, beautiful bill" as GOP eyes July 4 deadline
articles.description: The U.S. Senate has started a series of votes on a major legislative package proposed by Donald Trump, which includes extensions of tax cuts and changes to spending. The process, known as a "vote-a-rama," is expected to be a lengthy one as Republicans aim to pass the bill before the July 4th holiday.

articles.title: Man shot Idaho firefighters who had asked him to move his vehicle, killing 2, sheriff says
articles.description: A man in Idaho shot and killed two firefighters and injured a police officer after being asked to move his vehicle which was blocking access for emergency crews. The suspect, identified as Wess Roley, had previously expressed interest in becoming a firefighter.

articles.title: More than 300 charged in $14.6 billion health care fraud schemes takedown, Justice Department says
articles.description: The U.S. Justice Department has charged more than 300 individuals in connection with healthcare fraud schemes amounting to over $14.6 billion in false claims. The nationwide takedown targeted various types of fraud, including schemes involving telehealth, pharmaceuticals, and medical equipment.

articles.title: Bob Vylan's Glastonbury comments about BBC and Israel to be reviewed by police
articles.description: The UK police are reviewing comments made by the band Bob Vylan during their performance at the Glastonbury Festival. The band's frontman made statements critical of the BBC and the Israeli military, which have generated controversy.

articles.title: Senate passes Trump's big tax breaks and spending cuts bill
articles.description: The U.S. Senate has passed President Donald Trump's major tax and spending cuts bill after a turbulent session. The bill, which includes significant tax reductions and spending cuts to programs like Medicaid and food stamps, passed on a narrow 50-50 vote, with Vice President JD Vance casting the tie-breaking vote. [5, 8] The package will now return to the House for further consideration.

articles.title: Dalai Lama affirms succession plans, countering China
articles.description: The Dalai Lama has announced that the institution of the Dalai Lama will continue after his death and that his successor will be identified by his trust. [9, 10, 12] This move is a direct counter to China's insistence that it has the right to choose his successor. [9, 16] China's foreign ministry stated that the reincarnation must be approved by the central government. [9]

articles.title: Hamas responds to Gaza ceasefire proposal, seeks end to war
articles.description: Hamas has submitted its response to a U.S.-backed ceasefire proposal for Gaza, stating that it is seeking a permanent end to the war. [3, 11] The proposal reportedly includes a 60-day ceasefire and the release of Israeli captives in exchange for Palestinian prisoners. [7] While Hamas says it responded positively, it also noted that the current proposal does not guarantee an end to the conflict. [3]

articles.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs acquitted of sex trafficking, convicted on lesser charges
articles.description: A federal jury acquitted hip-hop mogul Sean 'Diddy' Combs of the most serious charges of racketeering and sex trafficking. However, he was found guilty on two lesser counts involving prostitution and will remain in custody after being denied bail.

articles.title: Trump's 'Big, Beautiful Bill' passes Senate, heads to House
articles.description: President Trump's significant tax and spending bill, dubbed the 'Big, Beautiful Bill,' has been passed by the Senate and is now set for a final vote in the House of Representatives.

articles.title: Liverpool FC player Diogo Jota killed in car crash
articles.description: Liverpool and Portugal football star Diogo Jota has been killed in a car crash. The news has been met with shock and mourning from the football community.

articles.title: House passes 'big, beautiful bill,' sending it to Trump's desk in 218-214 vote
articles.description: The U.S. House of Representatives passed a major tax and spending bill, a key legislative priority for President Trump. The bill, which includes extensions of the 2017 tax cuts and increased funding for immigration and defense, passed by a narrow margin of 218-214 and now heads to the President's desk to be signed into law. [4, 7]

articles.title: Liverpool star Diogo Jota killed in car crash in Spain
articles.description: Liverpool forward Diogo Jota, 28, and his brother were killed in a car accident in Spain. The vehicle they were in veered off the road and caught fire near Zamora. The football world has been in mourning, with tributes pouring in for the Portuguese international. [3, 5, 6, 8, 9]

articles.title: Israel expands Gaza no-go zones, kills 138 in a day
articles.description: Israeli forces have killed at least 138 Palestinians in Gaza in the last 24 hours, according to the Gaza Health Ministry. The attacks come as Israel expands its ground operations and continues to strike what it describes as 'terror targets' across the Strip. [14]

articles.title: Dozens dead, 23 girls missing after Texas flash floods
articles.description: Devastating flash floods in Texas have resulted in at least 24 fatalities, with a desperate search underway for 23 girls missing from a summer camp.

articles.title: Russia launches largest missile and drone barrage on Kyiv since war began
articles.description: Russia has unleashed its most extensive missile and drone attack on the Ukrainian capital of Kyiv since the start of the war, causing significant damage. In response, Ukraine claims to have successfully struck a Russian airbase.

articles.title: Israel kills 47 Palestinians as Hamas signals readiness for ceasefire talks
articles.description: Israeli strikes have killed at least 47 Palestinians in Gaza. Meanwhile, Hamas has indicated a 'positive spirit' in responding to a U.S.-backed ceasefire proposal.

articles.title: Texas floods leave at least 51 dead, 27 girls missing as rescuers search devastated landscape
articles.description: Catastrophic flash floods in the Texas Hill Country have resulted in at least 51 deaths, with rescue teams continuing to search for missing individuals, including 27 girls from a summer camp. The severe weather has caused widespread devastation.

articles.title: Gaza ceasefire talks set to resume in Doha as Israeli airstrikes continue
articles.description: Talks aimed at securing a ceasefire in Gaza are expected to resume in Doha, Qatar. Meanwhile, Israeli airstrikes on the territory have continued. Hamas has reportedly responded positively to the latest truce proposal.

articles.title: French intelligence claims China trying to foil global sale of Rafale jets
articles.description: A report from French intelligence agencies alleges that China has been actively working to undermine the international sales of France's Rafale fighter jets. The report suggests that Chinese embassies were involved in these efforts.

articles.title: Death toll in Texas flash floods rises to 82, with 10 campers still missing
articles.description: Catastrophic flash floods in central Texas over the Fourth of July holiday weekend have resulted in the deaths of at least 82 people. A significant number of the victims were children and counselors at Camp Mystic, an all-girls summer camp that was devastated by the rapidly rising waters of the Guadalupe River. Search and rescue operations are ongoing for those who remain missing.

articles.title: Australian woman Erin Patterson convicted of murdering three with poisoned mushrooms
articles.description: An Australian woman, Erin Patterson, has been found guilty of murdering three of her estranged husband's relatives by serving them a meal containing poisonous death cap mushrooms. She was also convicted of the attempted murder of a fourth person who fell ill but survived. The case, which involved a fatal beef Wellington lunch, has garnered significant media attention in Australia and internationally.

articles.title: Elon Musk announces he is forming a new political party called the 'America Party'
articles.description: Elon Musk has announced the formation of a new political party, the 'America Party,' following a public split with former President Donald Trump over a tax cuts law. Musk, who has been a vocal critic of the bill, stated on social media that the new party is intended to provide an alternative to the two-party system.

articles.title: Texas floods death toll climbs to more than 100
articles.description: The death toll from devastating flash floods at a summer camp in Texas has risen to over 100. The tragedy occurred at Camp Mystic, where a wall of water swept through, leaving a scene of destruction.

articles.title: Netanyahu, Trump discuss forced transfer of Palestinians out of Gaza
articles.description: Former US President Donald Trump and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu have reportedly discussed the forced transfer of Palestinians from Gaza. This comes as ceasefire talks between Israel and Hamas are reportedly taking place in Doha.

articles.title: Former Russian transport minister found dead hours after being sacked by Putin
articles.description: Roman Starovoy, the former transport minister of Russia, was found dead just hours after being dismissed from his post by President Vladimir Putin. The circumstances surrounding his death are under investigation.

articles.title: Trump, Israel's Netanyahu meet for a second time about a ceasefire in Gaza
articles.description: US President Donald Trump and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu held a second meeting in 24 hours to discuss a potential ceasefire deal in Gaza. The unscheduled talks at the White House lasted over an hour. This comes as Trump's Middle East envoy indicated that Israel and Hamas are getting closer to an agreement.

articles.title: ICC issues arrest warrants for Taliban leaders over alleged persecution of women
articles.description: The International Criminal Court (ICC) has issued arrest warrants for two senior Taliban leaders, Supreme Leader Haibatullah Akhunzada and Chief Justice Abdul Hakim Haqqani. The charges relate to the alleged crime against humanity of gender persecution against women and girls in Afghanistan since the Taliban's takeover in August 2021.

articles.title: Post Office scandal may have led to more than 13 suicides, official inquiry finds
articles.description: A public inquiry into the UK's Post Office scandal has found that more than 13 people may have taken their own lives as a result of the wrongful prosecution of post office workers. The report highlighted the 'disastrous human impact' of the Horizon IT scandal, where faulty software led to accusations of theft and false accounting.

articles.title: Bharat Bandh: Nationwide strike by trade unions disrupts key services
articles.description: A nationwide strike, or Bharat Bandh, called by a coalition of ten central trade unions on Wednesday, July 9, 2025, caused significant disruptions to essential services across India. Sectors including banking, transportation, and postal services were impacted as workers protested against government policies.

articles.title: Trump threatens to slap Brazil with 50 percent tariffs over treatment of Bolsonaro
articles.description: President Trump has threatened to impose 50% tariffs on Brazil, linking the move to what he described as a "Witch Hunt" against former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro. This action marks a significant escalation in trade tensions between the two countries.

articles.title: Two pilots killed after IAF Jaguar fighter jet crashes near Churu in Rajasthan
articles.description: A Jaguar trainer aircraft of the Indian Air Force (IAF) crashed near Churu in Rajasthan on Wednesday, July 9, 2025, resulting in the deaths of both pilots. The IAF has initiated a court of inquiry to determine the cause of the accident which occurred during a routine training mission.

articles.title: Before-and-after images show RVs swept away, homes destroyed by Texas floods
articles.description: Devastating flash floods in central Texas have resulted in over 120 fatalities, with approximately 170 people still unaccounted for. The Guadalupe River experienced a rapid and significant rise, leading to the destruction of homes and RV parks. Aerial photographs reveal the extensive damage in areas like Kerr County, where communities were overwhelmed by the floodwaters.

articles.title: State Department to start layoffs in coming days, cutting U.S. staff by 15% - CBS News
articles.description: The U.S. State Department is set to begin a significant workforce reduction, with layoffs commencing as part of a broader reorganization plan by the Trump administration. The cuts will impact over 1,300 employees through a combination of layoffs and voluntary departures, aiming to streamline domestic operations. [6]

articles.title: Germany suspends refugees' family reunification â DW â 06/27/2025
articles.description: The German parliament has approved a measure to suspend family reunification for refugees who hold a "subsidiary protection" status, which is a step below full asylum. [3] This decision is part of a government effort to tighten immigration regulations and will primarily impact Syrian families. [3]

articles.title: How Air India flight crashed: Fatal last moments of AI-171
articles.description: New details have emerged about the final moments of Air India flight AI-171 before it crashed. Investigations are ongoing to determine the cause of the incident.

articles.title: Israeli settlers beat American to death in West Bank; US says it's aware
articles.description: An American citizen was reportedly beaten to death by Israeli settlers in the West Bank. The United States has acknowledged that it is aware of the incident.

articles.title: Iran's attack on Qatar air base hit geodesic dome used for US communications, satellite photos show
articles.description: Satellite imagery indicates that an Iranian attack on an air base in Qatar struck a geodesic dome that is utilized for United States military communications.

articles.title: Trump says he's considering 'taking away' Rosie O'Donnell's US citizenship
articles.description: Former President Donald Trump has stated he is considering revoking the U.S. citizenship of comedian Rosie O'Donnell. This comes after O'Donnell's remarks regarding the recent flooding in Texas. The statement has drawn significant attention and is a top story across multiple news outlets.

articles.title: Israeli forces bombard Gaza as Israel-Hamas ceasefire talks stall
articles.description: Israeli forces have continued to bombard the Gaza Strip as negotiations for a ceasefire with Hamas have reportedly stalled. The ongoing conflict has resulted in a significant number of casualties and has become a focal point of international attention, with live updates being provided by various news agencies.

articles.title: Trump slaps 30% tariffs on all goods from EU and Mexico
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump has announced the imposition of 30% tariffs on all goods imported from the European Union and Mexico. This move is expected to have significant repercussions on international trade and has prompted vows of a response from the EU.

articles.title: Wildfire destroys a historic Grand Canyon lodge and other structures
articles.description: A fast-moving wildfire has destroyed the historic Grand Canyon Lodge on the North Rim, along with dozens of other structures. The Dragon Bravo Fire, which was started by lightning, grew rapidly due to hot, dry, and windy conditions, forcing the closure of the North Rim for the season.

articles.title: Two dead and three injured, including state trooper, in Kentucky shootings
articles.description: A shooting incident in Lexington, Kentucky, has left two people dead and three others injured, including a state trooper. The suspect reportedly shot the trooper during a traffic stop, fled the scene, and then opened fire at a church before being shot by police.

articles.title: Trump says US will send Patriot missiles to Ukraine
articles.description: Former President Donald Trump has announced that the United States will be sending Patriot missile defense systems to Ukraine. This statement marks a significant development in the ongoing discussions about military aid to the country.

articles.title: Trump threatens Russia with tariffs and boosts US weapons for Ukraine
articles.description: In a significant policy shift, President Donald Trump has issued a 50-day ultimatum to Russia to agree to a ceasefire in Ukraine. He has threatened steep tariffs on nations that continue to trade with Russia if the deadline is not met and has also announced plans to provide Ukraine with billions of dollars in advanced weaponry. [2, 3, 4]

articles.title: Israeli ultra-Orthodox party quits Netanyahu government over conscription
articles.description: The United Torah Judaism party has withdrawn from Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's ruling coalition. The move comes in response to a dispute over a military conscription bill affecting ultra-Orthodox Jews, leaving Netanyahu's government with a narrow majority in the Knesset. [1]

articles.title: A wildfire that destroyed historic Grand Canyon Lodge spread after being allowed to burn for days
articles.description: A wildfire at the Grand Canyon has resulted in the destruction of the historic Grand Canyon Lodge. Reports indicate that the fire expanded after authorities allowed it to burn for several days under observation. [2]

articles.title: Israel launches attack on Syrian Defence Ministry, near presidential palace
articles.description: Israel has conducted airstrikes in Damascus, targeting the Syrian Defence Ministry headquarters and other military sites. These attacks come amidst escalating tensions and clashes in the region, particularly in the city of Suwayda.

articles.title: Trump says 'credible' Epstein files should be released amid MAGA revolt
articles.description: Former President Donald Trump has stated that any 'credible' files related to Jeffrey Epstein should be made public. This statement comes as he faces pressure from some of his supporters to address conspiracy theories surrounding the case.

articles.title: Federal judge reverses rule that would have removed medical debt from credit reports
articles.description: A federal judge has overturned a Biden administration rule that would have prevented medical debt from appearing on consumers' credit reports. The ruling means that this type of debt can continue to affect credit scores.

articles.title: Israeli attack on Gaza's only Catholic church kills elderly people
articles.description: An Israeli airstrike has hit the Holy Family Church, the only Catholic church in Gaza City, resulting in the deaths of two elderly women. The strike has drawn condemnation, with Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni calling attacks on civilians "unacceptable".

articles.title: Senate approves $9 billion in cuts to foreign aid, public broadcasting funding
articles.description: The U.S. Senate has passed a $9 billion package of spending cuts that targets foreign aid and the Corporation for Public Broadcasting. The measure, which was requested by President Trump, will now go to the House for a final vote.

articles.title: India in touch with local authorities in Yemen to resolve Nimisha Priya case, says MEA
articles.description: The Indian government has stated that it is in contact with Yemeni authorities and other friendly nations to find a solution for Nimisha Priya, an Indian nurse who is on death row in Yemen. Her execution, which was scheduled for July 16, has been postponed.

articles.title: Trump diagnosed with 'chronic venous insufficiency' after swelling: White House
articles.description: Following observations of swelling in his legs and bruising on his hand, the White House physician announced that President Trump has been diagnosed with chronic venous insufficiency, a common condition in older adults.

articles.title: 'Late Show With Stephen Colbert' Is Being Canceled by CBS
articles.description: CBS has announced that "The Late Show with Stephen Colbert" will end in May 2026, concluding the host's long run and the network's "The Late Show" franchise.

articles.title: NFLPA executive director Lloyd Howell resigns amid conflict of interest, collusion controversies
articles.description: Lloyd Howell has resigned from his position as the executive director of the NFL Players Association. His resignation comes amidst controversies related to a conflict of interest and potential collusion.

articles.title: 3 LA sheriff's deputies killed in explosion at training facility in department's biggest loss of life since 1857
articles.description: An explosion at a Los Angeles County sheriff's training facility in Castaic, California, resulted in the deaths of three deputies. The incident is being investigated as a tragic accident and marks the department's largest loss of life since its early days.

articles.title: Trump sues Wall Street Journal and media mogul Rupert Murdoch over reporting on Epstein ties
articles.description: Former President Donald Trump has filed a lawsuit against The Wall Street Journal and its owner, Rupert Murdoch, over an article detailing his alleged ties to Jeffrey Epstein. The lawsuit follows a report by the newspaper about a letter Trump allegedly sent to Epstein in 2003.

articles.title: Stephen Colbert's 'Late Show' is canceled by CBS and will end in May 2026
articles.description: CBS has announced the cancellation of "The Late Show with Stephen Colbert," with the final episode scheduled to air in May 2026. The network cited financial reasons for the decision to end the long-running late-night talk show.

articles.title: 73 Palestinians killed while waiting for humanitarian aid across Gaza, health ministry says
articles.description: The health ministry in Gaza reports that 73 people have been killed while waiting for aid at locations across the Palestinian territory. This comes as Israeli attacks on aid seekers continue amid new evacuation threats.

articles.title: Trump sues Wall Street Journal and media mogul Rupert Murdoch over reporting on Epstein ties
articles.description: Former US President Donald Trump has filed a lawsuit against The Wall Street Journal and its parent company's chairman, Rupert Murdoch, over an article detailing his alleged connections to the late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. The US Justice Department has also filed a motion to unseal grand jury transcripts in the Epstein cases.

articles.title: Astronomer CEO Andy Byron resigns after Coldplay 'kiss cam' video
articles.description: The CEO of the tech company Astronomer, Andy Byron, has resigned after a video of him with a coworker at a Coldplay concert went viral. The company's board launched an investigation into the incident.

articles.title: After killing aid seekers, Israel attacks water desalination plant in Gaza
articles.description: Israeli forces have targeted a water desalination plant in Gaza, an attack that followed the killing of people seeking aid. The death toll in Gaza has reportedly reached 59,000. [1]

articles.title: Bangladesh air force plane crashes into college campus, killing at least 19
articles.description: A training aircraft of the Bangladesh air force crashed into a college campus in Dhaka, resulting in the death of at least 19 people. [1, 3]

articles.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,243
articles.description: As the war in Ukraine continues, key events are being tracked. On day 1,243, Russia launched a significant aerial attack on Kyiv just hours before high-level talks about support for Ukraine were set to begin. [1, 3]

articles.title: Malcolm-Jamal Warner, 'Cosby Show' actor, dies at 54 in Costa Rica drowning
articles.description: Actor Malcolm-Jamal Warner, best known for his role as Theo Huxtable on "The Cosby Show," has died at the age of 54 after a drowning incident in Costa Rica. Warner was a beloved figure for many who grew up watching the show.

articles.title: Bangladesh students protest after air force jet crash into school kills 31
articles.description: A Bangladeshi air force training jet crashed into a school in Dhaka, killing at least 31 people, including many students. The incident has sparked protests by students demanding answers and improved safety measures.

articles.title: Trump pulls US out of UN cultural agency UNESCO for second time
articles.description: The Trump administration has announced that the United States will withdraw from the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) for the second time. The administration cited concerns of an anti-Israel bias within the organization.

articles.title: Gaza logs 15 new deaths from hunger, taking toll since Israel's war to 101
articles.description: At least 15 Palestinians, including four children, have died from starvation in a single day in the besieged Gaza Strip, according to health officials, bringing the total number of deaths from malnutrition since Israel's war began to 101.

articles.title: More than 100 NGOs warn Israel's forced 'mass starvation' stalks all Gaza
articles.description: More than 100 aid and human rights groups have called on governments to take urgent action as Israel's forced âmass starvationâ of Palestinians engulfs Gaza.

articles.title: Zelenskyy faces backlash as Ukrainians protest new anti-corruption law
articles.description: Ukrainian activists are calling for more protests of a law they say weakens the country's anti-corruption bodies.

articles.title: Columbia University makes deal with Trump administration, agrees to pay more than $220 million to restore federal funding
articles.description: Columbia University has reached a settlement with the Trump administration, agreeing to a payment of over $220 million to have its federal funding restored. This follows a period of dispute between the university and the government.

articles.title: Justice Department will meet with Ghislaine Maxwell, Jeffrey Epstein's imprisoned girlfriend
articles.description: Officials from the Justice Department are scheduled to meet with Ghislaine Maxwell, who is currently imprisoned for her role in the Jeffrey Epstein sex trafficking scandal. This development comes as a House subcommittee has also voted to subpoena the Justice Department for files related to Epstein.

articles.title: Classes, gov't work in Metro Manila, several provinces suspended on July 25, 2025
articles.description: Due to the anticipated heavy rainfall from Typhoon Emong and the Southwest Monsoon, classes at all levels and government work in Metro Manila and various other provinces have been suspended for Friday, July 25, 2025. The measure is intended to ensure public safety amidst the adverse weather conditions.

articles.title: Trump plays golf in Scotland while protesters take to the streets and decry his visit
articles.description: President Donald Trump played golf at his course on Scotland's coast while protesters around the country demonstrated against his visit, accusing United Kingdom leaders of pandering to the American president. [5]

articles.title: Israeli gunfire and strikes kill at least 25 in Gaza as many of the dead sought aid
articles.description: Israeli military actions in Gaza have resulted in the deaths of at least 25 people. Reports indicate that many of the deceased were seeking humanitarian aid at the time of the strikes. [1, 5]

articles.title: Thailand declares martial law in 8 Cambodia border regions
articles.description: The government of Thailand has imposed martial law in eight regions along its border with Cambodia. [2]

articles.title: 11 wounded in stabbing attack at Michigan Walmart, suspect in custody
articles.description: A suspect is in custody after allegedly stabbing 11 people at a Walmart in Michigan. Officials stated the stabbings appeared to be random and occurred near the checkout area of the store. [4, 8, 12]

articles.title: Israel announces daily 'tactical pause' in parts of starving Gaza
articles.description: The Israeli military announced it would hold daily tactical pauses in fighting in parts of Gaza to allow humanitarian aid to enter. The move comes after the U.S. ended ceasefire talks, and as the United Nations has warned of a worsening starvation crisis and deaths from malnutrition. [5, 8, 10]

articles.title: Trump plays golf in Scotland amid nationwide protests
articles.description: During a visit to his golf resort in Scotland, Donald Trump was met by hundreds of protesters who gathered to demonstrate against his presence. Protests took place in front of the U.S. Consulate in Edinburgh, Scotland's capital. [2, 4, 8, 12]

articles.title: Man accused of stabbing 11 people at a Walmart is in Michigan authorities' custody
articles.description: A man stabbed 11 people at a Walmart in Michigan, leaving six in critical condition. The suspect, who was tackled by shoppers, is now in custody and faces a terrorism charge. [3, 5, 8]

articles.title: US and EU reach trade deal, Trump announces
articles.description: President Donald Trump and European Union chief Ursula von der Leyen announced a trade agreement during talks in Scotland. [6, 9] The deal aims to avert a potential trade war by addressing tariffs. [1, 4]

articles.title: Israel begins daily pause in fighting in parts of Gaza to allow aid as hunger grows
articles.description: The Israeli military has started a limited daily pause in fighting in three areas of Gaza for 10 hours a day to allow humanitarian aid to enter, as concerns about severe hunger increase. [1, 5, 9] Aid trucks have begun crossing from Egypt into Gaza. [6, 12]

articles.title: Gunman kills 4, including police officer, in shooting at New York City office tower
articles.description: A gunman opened fire in a Manhattan office building, resulting in the deaths of four people, including a police officer. The suspect, identified as Shane Tamura, also died from a self-inflicted gunshot wound. The incident prompted a major police response and has raised concerns about gun violence.

articles.title: Inmates, pregnant woman among 27 killed in Russia's attacks on Ukraine
articles.description: Russian strikes across Ukraine have killed at least 27 people. The attacks hit various civilian areas, including a penal colony near Zaporizhzhia and a hospital in Kamianske where a pregnant woman was among the victims. Ukrainian officials have condemned the attacks as war crimes.

articles.title: 'Worst-case' famine scenario unfolding in Gaza, food security experts say
articles.description: According to the Integrated Food Security Phase Classification (IPC), a global hunger monitor, the Gaza Strip is experiencing a 'worst-case famine scenario'. The report highlights the severe impact of the ongoing conflict on the civilian population's access to food and basic necessities.

articles.title: Massive 8.8 Magnitude Earthquake Off Russia Triggers Pacific-Wide Tsunami Alerts
articles.description: An 8.8 magnitude earthquake, one of the most powerful ever recorded, struck off the coast of Russia's Far East, generating tsunami waves. The event prompted tsunami warnings and evacuations in coastal areas across the Pacific, including Japan, Hawaii, and the U.S. West Coast. Tsunami warnings were later downgraded for Hawaii as the situation was assessed.

articles.title: Trump Escalates Trade War with Canada Over Palestine Stance
articles.description: The White House has announced a new trade agreement with South Korea imposing a 15% tax on its imports, while simultaneously escalating a trade dispute with Canada. This comes after Canada, along with the UK and France, announced its intention to recognize a Palestinian state. President Trump has indicated that this move by Canada will make it very difficult to conclude a trade deal.

articles.title: Russian Missile and Drone Attack Kills Multiple People in Kyiv
articles.description: A recent Russian missile and drone attack on the Ukrainian capital of Kyiv has resulted in the deaths of at least nine people and has left over 120 wounded. The attack caused significant damage to civilian infrastructure.

articles.title: 25 Injured After Severe Turbulence on Delta Flight
articles.description: A Delta flight from Utah to Amsterdam encountered severe turbulence, resulting in injuries to 25 passengers. The plane was diverted and made an emergency landing. The extent of the injuries is currently being assessed.

articles.title: US Adds Just 73,000 Jobs in July, Far Below Expectations as Trump Unveils Global Tariffs
articles.description: The U.S. economy added only 73,000 jobs in July, significantly underperforming expectations as President Donald Trump announced new global tariffs. The unemployment rate saw a slight increase to 4.2%. Adding to the concern, the Bureau of Labor Statistics made significant downward revisions to the job numbers for May and June, reducing them by a combined 258,000.

articles.title: Trump Imposes Sweeping New Tariffs on Dozens of Countries
articles.description: President Trump has signed an executive order for new "reciprocal" tariffs, with rates from 10% to 41%, on imports from numerous countries, set to begin on August 7. Additionally, tariffs on certain Canadian goods were raised to 35% effective August 1, due to what the White House described as a lack of cooperation on curbing illicit drug trafficking. These actions have led to a downturn in global stock markets.

articles.title: El Salvador Scraps Presidential Term Limits, Paving Way for Indefinite Re-election
articles.description: El Salvador's congress has approved constitutional reforms that remove presidential term limits, allowing for indefinite re-election. The changes, supported by President Nayib Bukele's New Ideas party, also extend the presidential term from five to six years and eliminate the second round of elections. This move has been met with criticism from opposition leaders and human rights groups, who fear it will lead to a one-party state and the erosion of democracy.

articles.title: Republicans slam Trump's firing of Bureau of Labor Statistics chief
articles.description: President Trump fired the head of the Bureau of Labor Statistics after the release of figures showing a slowdown in jobs, claiming the numbers were 'rigged' to make him look bad. The move has drawn criticism from members of his own party.

articles.title: 'We are dying slowly, save us': starvation takes hold in Gaza
articles.description: A week of grim milestones in Gaza has seen starvation become widespread. A US envoy has visited a food distribution site as the United Nations reports that 1,373 people have been killed while waiting for aid since late May.

articles.title: Former US soldier suspected in Montana bar shooting that killed 4
articles.description: A manhunt is underway for a former US soldier who is the suspect in a bar shooting in Montana that left four people dead. This event marks the ninth mass murder in the United States in 2025.

articles.title: Storm Floris prompts 'danger to life' warning for parts of UK
articles.description: A 'danger to life' amber weather warning has been issued for parts of the UK as Storm Floris is expected to bring winds of up to 90mph.

articles.title: Case Against Army Officer And SpiceJet Staffer He Assaulted Over Luggage
articles.description: A police case has been filed against an Army officer and a SpiceJet staffer he is accused of assaulting at Srinagar airport over a dispute about excess cabin luggage.

articles.title: Dormant Russia volcano erupts for first time in 450 years days after Kamchatka earthquake
articles.description: A volcano in Russia's Kamchatka Peninsula has erupted for the first time in 450 years, just days after a major earthquake in the region. This has raised concerns about the potential for a tsunami.

articles.title: Netanyahu asks Red Cross for help after 'profound shock' of Gaza hostage videos
articles.description: Following the release of harrowing videos showing the condition of hostages in Gaza, Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu has asked the Red Cross for assistance. The father of one emaciated captive described the footage as watching your son die before your eyes. Hamas has reportedly agreed to allow the Red Cross access if Israel opens aid corridors.

articles.title: â25% not enoughâ: Trump says he may increase tariffs on India in the next 24 hours
articles.description: US President Donald Trump has indicated a potential escalation in his trade stance against India, stating that the current 25% tariff on all Indian imports may be raised "substantially" within the next 24 hours. [6] Trump's threat is linked to India's continued purchase of Russian crude oil. [6] New Delhi has described the tariff threat as âunjustified and unreasonable.â [6]

articles.title: House panel subpoenas Clintons and other ex-officials in Epstein probe, seeks files from DOJ
articles.description: The House Oversight Committee has issued subpoenas to former President Bill Clinton, former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton, and several former top law enforcement officials for depositions related to the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. [3] The committee also subpoenaed the Justice Department for all files connected to the sex trafficking inquiry. [7] The move is part of a congressional probe into the handling of the Epstein case and seeks to uncover more information about the convicted sex offender and his associates. [3]

articles.title: A shipwreck off Yemen has killed 56 migrants and left 132 missing, UN says in revised figures
articles.description: A boat carrying 200 African migrants capsized off the coast of Yemen, resulting in the death of 56 people, with 132 still missing, according to revised figures from the U.N. migration agency. [5] The shipwreck is the latest in a series of deadly incidents involving migrants attempting to reach Gulf countries. [5] The vessel sank off the coast of Shuqrah in the southern province of Abyan. [5]

articles.title: Trump Imposes Additional 25% Tariff on India Over Russian Oil Imports
articles.description: Former US President Donald Trump has signed an executive order imposing an additional 25% tariff on Indian goods. The move is a response to India's continued purchase of Russian oil, which the White House says is funding Russia's war in Ukraine. This takes the total tariff on Indian goods to 50%.

articles.title: Gaza Civil Defence Says Israeli Attacks Kill 68 In 24 Hours
articles.description: Gaza's civil defence agency reported that 68 people were killed by Israeli gunfire and air strikes within a 24-hour period. Among the casualties, 56 were reportedly waiting near aid distribution sites in the Palestinian territory.

articles.title: France's largest wildfire this summer leaves one dead and many injured
articles.description: A major wildfire, the largest in France this summer, has resulted in one death and numerous injuries. The fire has burned an area larger than Paris and continues to spread.

articles.title: "His Greatest Ire...": Expert On Why Trump Tariffs Target India
articles.description: As India makes it clear that it is ready to stand up to the United States' sudden tariff hike on Indian imports, an expert explains the potential reasons behind Donald Trump's focus on India rather than China. [3]

articles.title: Fort Stewart Army sergeant in custody after he shot 5 soldiers, officials say
articles.description: A sergeant at Fort Stewart is in custody after allegedly shooting five fellow soldiers. This incident is currently under investigation by officials. [2]

articles.title: Four Palestinians starve to death in Gaza in past 24 hours
articles.description: Gaza's Ministry of Health has reported that four more individuals have died from famine and malnutrition within the last 24 hours, increasing the total number of deaths due to starvation to 197 since the conflict began. [7, 8]

articles.title: Israel's Security Cabinet approves plan for Israeli military to take control of Gaza City
articles.description: Israel's Security Cabinet has approved a plan for the military to take control of Gaza City. This move is seen as a major escalation in the ongoing conflict and has raised concerns for the safety of civilians and hostages in the area.

articles.title: Trump's new tariffs on dozens of countries take effect
articles.description: New tariffs imposed by the Trump administration on dozens of countries have now come into effect. This action is expected to have a significant impact on global trade and has drawn reactions from various nations.

articles.title: Fast-growing brush fire forces thousands to evacuate north of Los Angeles
articles.description: A rapidly spreading brush fire north of Los Angeles has prompted evacuation orders for thousands of residents. The fire, which started in the Los Padres National Forest, has already burned a significant area.

articles.title: Israel approves plan to take over Gaza City as Netanyahu aims to broaden war
articles.description: Israel's security cabinet has approved a plan to take over Gaza City, which would significantly expand its military operations. The move has drawn international criticism and concern for civilian safety. [5, 9, 10]

articles.title: Trump and Putin will meet in Alaska next week, Trump says
articles.description: President Trump announced he will meet with Russian President Vladimir Putin in Alaska next week to discuss the war in Ukraine. [6, 9, 14]

articles.title: Officer killed, gunman dead in shooting at CDC and Emory campus in Atlanta
articles.description: A police officer and a suspect were killed in a shooting near the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and Emory University in Atlanta. [2, 14]

articles.title: Netanyahu defends Gaza military offensive, says Israel must 'finish the job'
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu defended Israel's military offensive in Gaza, stating that their goal is not to occupy the territory but to 'free Gaza' and that they must 'finish the job'. This has been met with growing international condemnation.

articles.title: European leaders rally behind Ukraine ahead of Trump-Putin meeting
articles.description: With a summit between U.S. President Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin planned, European nations have expressed their support for Ukraine. Ukrainian President Zelenskyy has stated that a summit without Ukraine's involvement will not achieve anything.

articles.title: CDC shooter believed COVID vaccine made him suicidal, his father tells police
articles.description: The Georgia Bureau of Investigation has identified the gunman in a shooting near Emory University and the CDC as 30-year-old Patrick Joseph White. According to his father, White believed that the COVID-19 vaccine had made him suicidal.

articles.title: Israel kills 5 Al Jazeera staff in Gaza
articles.description: Funerals have been held for five Al Jazeera staff who were killed in a targeted Israeli attack in Gaza City. Al Jazeera has condemned the killings of correspondents Anas al-Sharif and Mohammed Qreiqeh, cameramen Ibrahim Zaher and Moamen Aliwa, and their assistant Mohammed Noufal, calling it a âdesperate attempt to silence the voices exposing the impending seizure and occupation of Gazaâ. [5]

articles.title: European leaders rally behind Ukraine ahead of Trump-Putin meeting
articles.description: European leaders are voicing their support for Ukraine ahead of a planned meeting between U.S. President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin to discuss ending the war. Ukrainian President Zelenskyy has rejected the idea of formally ceding any Ukrainian territory and stated that Kyiv must be part of any negotiations concerning its future. [12]

articles.title: Trump raises U.S. tariffs on Indian imports to 50%
articles.description: The United States has increased tariffs on Indian imports to 50%, a move that has drawn sharp criticism from India's Defence Minister Rajnath Singh. Singh suggested that major global powers are envious of India's rapid growth and asserted that nothing can hinder the country's path to becoming a superpower. [3, 6]

articles.title: Trump places Washington D.C. police under federal control, deploys National Guard
articles.description: President Trump has ordered the Washington, D.C. police force to be placed under federal control and has deployed the National Guard, citing a 'crime emergency.' The move has been met with criticism from D.C. Mayor Muriel Bowser, who called it 'unsettling.' This action is being challenged as unprecedented, with legal analyses questioning its basis as crime statistics have reportedly shown a decline.

articles.title: Al Jazeera journalist Anas al-Sharif and other journalists killed in Gaza strike
articles.description: An Israeli airstrike in Gaza has killed Al Jazeera correspondent Anas al-Sharif and four other journalists. The Israel Defense Forces claimed that al-Sharif was a 'Hamas operative,' an allegation that Al Jazeera and press freedom organizations have condemned. The killings have drawn international condemnation and renewed concerns about the safety of journalists covering the conflict.

articles.title: 3 killed in shooting at Austin, Texas Target parking lot
articles.description: A shooter killed three people in the parking lot of a Target store in Austin, Texas, before being apprehended by police. The motive for the shooting is currently under investigation. The incident has added to the ongoing national conversation about gun violence.

articles.title: Israel pounds Gaza City, 123 dead in last 24 hours
articles.description: Israel's military pounded Gaza City on Wednesday, with another 123 people killed in the last day according to the Gaza health ministry. The 24-hour death toll was the worst in a week and added to the massive fatalities from the nearly two-year war.

articles.title: Zelenskyy and other European leaders to speak with Trump ahead of his Friday summit with Putin
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and other European leaders are set to speak with U.S. President Donald Trump ahead of his planned summit with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday.

articles.title: At least 3 dead and thousands displaced as wildfires rage across southern Europe
articles.description: Wildfires are raging across southern Europe, fanned by strong winds and searing temperatures. At least three people have died and thousands have been forced to evacuate their homes.

articles.title: Trump says he will push Putin for a ceasefire in Ukraine at Alaska summit
articles.description: President Trump announced he will press Russian President Vladimir Putin for a ceasefire in the ongoing war with Ukraine during their upcoming meeting in Alaska. This comes after a video call with European leaders and Ukrainian President Zelenskyy, where they lobbied for a ceasefire and security guarantees.

articles.title: Melania Trump demands Hunter Biden retract 'extremely salacious' Epstein comments
articles.description: Former First Lady Melania Trump is demanding a retraction from Hunter Biden for what she describes as 'extremely salacious' comments he made linking her to Jeffrey Epstein. The nature of the comments and the context in which they were made have not been fully detailed.

articles.title: Protesters rally against federal takeover of D.C. police
articles.description: Protesters gathered in Washington D.C. to voice their opposition to the recent federal takeover of the city's police force and the deployment of approximately 800 National Guard members. The demonstration included heckling of law enforcement at a newly established checkpoint.

articles.title: Trump heads to 'high stakes' Alaska summit with Putin on Ukraine
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump is meeting with Russian President Vladimir Putin in Alaska for a summit that is considered high-stakes and could be decisive for the future of the war in Ukraine. Trump stated on social media that he is "Not Here To Negotiate For Ukraine" ahead of the meeting.

articles.title: Flash floods triggered by torrential rains kill over 200 people in India and Pakistan
articles.description: Torrential monsoon rains have caused devastating flash floods in northwestern Pakistan and Indian-controlled Kashmir, resulting in the deaths of over 200 people. The death toll is expected to rise as many people are still missing.

articles.title: California pushes left, Texas to the right, with US House control and Trump agenda in play
articles.description: California's Democratic leaders are advancing a plan to create new congressional districts that would favor their party, in a direct response to a similar Republican-led effort in Texas. This move is part of a larger battle for control of the U.S. House of Representatives and could significantly impact the national political landscape.

articles.title: Zelenskyy to meet Trump on Monday after Putin summit briefing
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy announced he will travel to Washington on Monday to meet with U.S. President Donald Trump. The meeting follows a phone call where Trump briefed Zelenskyy on his summit with Russian President Vladimir Putin in Alaska. While the Alaska summit did not result in a ceasefire agreement for the ongoing war in Ukraine, Trump has proposed a trilateral meeting between the three leaders.

articles.title: Hurricane Erin explodes in strength to a Category 5 storm in the Caribbean
articles.description: Hurricane Erin has rapidly intensified into a Category 5 storm in the Caribbean, with maximum sustained winds reaching 160 mph. While the hurricane's center is currently forecast to remain offshore, it is expected to bring heavy rains and the risk of flash flooding and landslides to nearby islands, including Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands.

articles.title: Flooding kills over 300 people in Pakistan, India
articles.description: Severe flash floods and landslides triggered by heavy monsoon rains have resulted in the deaths of over 300 people across Pakistan and India. Rescue operations are underway as authorities search for many who are still missing. A helicopter involved in the relief efforts in Pakistan crashed due to bad weather, killing five people on board.

articles.title: European leaders to join Ukraine's Zelenskyy for White House meeting with Trump
articles.description: Following a summit between US President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin in Alaska, it was announced that European and NATO leaders will join Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Washington for peace talks. The discussions are expected to cover an end to the war with Russia and the possibility of U.S. security guarantees for Ukraine.

articles.title: Hurricane Erin explodes in strength to a Category 5 storm in Caribbean
articles.description: Hurricane Erin has rapidly intensified into a powerful Category 5 storm, with wind speeds reaching up to 160mph as it moves near the Caribbean. This significant increase in strength has put the region on high alert.

articles.title: Three killed, eight injured in shooting in crowded New York club
articles.description: A shooting at a lounge in New York City has resulted in the death of three people and left eight others wounded. The incident occurred in a crowded club, and investigations are currently underway.

articles.title: Zelenskyy to meet with Trump at White House for Ukraine talks
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy is scheduled to meet with President Trump at the White House, alongside several European leaders, to discuss the ongoing war with Russia. This meeting follows a summit between President Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin in Alaska which did not result in a ceasefire deal.

articles.title: Air Canada strike continues as flight attendants defy back-to-work order
articles.description: Air Canada's flight attendants have continued their strike over pay and scheduling disputes, refusing a government order to return to work. The ongoing strike has led to the cancellation of hundreds of flights, affecting an estimated 100,000 travelers daily.

articles.title: Hurricane Erin to bring dangerous surf and rip currents to East Coast
articles.description: Hurricane Erin, a Category 4 storm, is expected to cause life-threatening surf and rip currents along the U.S. East Coast. While the hurricane is not projected to make landfall, its effects will be felt along the coastline.

articles.title: Trump threatens Putin with 'rough situation' if he doesn't agree Ukraine peace deal
articles.description: Former US President Donald Trump has stated that he would create a 'rough situation' for Russian President Vladimir Putin if he does not agree to a peace deal with Ukraine. This comes after Russia launched a large aerial bombardment on Ukraine.

articles.title: White House says more than 450 people arrested since start of federal crackdown on crime in DC
articles.description: The White House has announced that over 450 individuals have been arrested in Washington D.C. as part of an ongoing federal crackdown on crime in the city.

articles.title: Busta Rhymes and Ricky Martin will make history at 2025 MTV VMAs. Here's who is taking the stage
articles.description: Busta Rhymes and Ricky Martin are set to make history at the 2025 MTV Video Music Awards. The article details their upcoming performances and lists other artists who will be taking the stage.

articles.title: FDA urges recall of Walmart shrimp over radioactive contamination fear
articles.description: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration has issued a warning for consumers not to eat Great Value brand frozen raw shrimp sold at Walmart and is investigating potential contamination with the radioactive isotope Cesium-137. [4, 6, 8] The FDA detected the substance in a shipment that did not enter the U.S. market but is recommending Walmart recall three lots of the shrimp processed by an Indonesian company. [4]

articles.title: NASA's Webb telescope finds a new tiny moon around Uranus
articles.description: Astronomers using NASA's James Webb Space Telescope have discovered a new, small moon orbiting Uranus, bringing the planet's total number of known moons to 29. [2, 3, 12] The newly found moon is estimated to be about 6 miles in diameter. [12] The discovery was made using the telescope's Near-Infrared Camera (NIRCam). [2]

articles.title: Trump administration revokes security clearances of 37 current and former U.S. officials
articles.description: The Trump administration has revoked the security clearances of 37 current and former national security officials. [1, 5] The director of national intelligence, Tulsi Gabbard, stated that this action was taken against individuals accused of politicizing intelligence. [5] The list of officials includes some who were involved in the assessment of Russian interference in the 2016 election. [1, 5]

articles.title: Russia launches major drone and missile attack on Ukraine
articles.description: Russia has launched one of its most extensive aerial attacks on Ukraine, firing 574 drones and 40 ballistic and cruise missiles. The attack has resulted in at least one death and multiple injuries, and has targeted various regions across the country.

articles.title: Ukrainian man arrested in Italy over Nord Stream pipeline blasts
articles.description: A Ukrainian man has been arrested in Italy in connection with the 2022 explosions that damaged the Nord Stream gas pipelines. The arrest is a significant development in the ongoing investigation into the sabotage of the underwater pipelines.

articles.title: New York court throws out $527 million penalty in Trump civil fraud case
articles.description: A New York appellate court has overturned a $527 million penalty against Donald Trump in his civil fraud case. The court's decision is a significant legal victory for the former president.

articles.title: FBI searches home of former Trump national security adviser John Bolton
articles.description: The FBI has conducted a search of the home of John Bolton, who served as national security adviser to former President Donald Trump. The focus of the investigation is reportedly on whether Bolton illegally possessed or shared classified information.

articles.title: Federal judge orders Florida to dismantle 'Alligator Alcatraz' immigrant detention facility
articles.description: A federal judge has ordered the state of Florida to shut down and dismantle an immigrant detention facility in the Everglades, referred to as 'Alligator Alcatraz'. The ruling cited environmental concerns and gives the state 60 days to comply.

articles.title: Famine confirmed in Gaza City region, global hunger monitor says
articles.description: A global hunger monitor has officially confirmed that famine is present in the Gaza City region. The report indicates that over half a million people are facing catastrophic conditions characterized by starvation and death.

articles.title: FBI searches home and office of ex-Trump national security adviser John Bolton
articles.description: The FBI has conducted searches of the home and office of John Bolton, who served as a national security adviser in the Trump administration. This action is part of an ongoing investigation, the specifics of which have not been fully disclosed.

articles.title: Maxwell discusses Trump, Clinton and Prince Andrew: Takeaways from DOJ interviews
articles.description: Newly released transcripts from Justice Department interviews with Ghislaine Maxwell reveal her recollections and interactions with prominent figures such as Donald Trump, Bill Clinton, and Prince Andrew, in connection with the Jeffrey Epstein case.

articles.title: 'Man-made disaster': Famine declared in Gaza City where half a million face starvation
articles.description: An official declaration of famine has been made for Gaza City, where it is estimated that half a million people are facing starvation. Aid organizations have described the situation as a 'man-made disaster' resulting from the ongoing conflict and restrictions on humanitarian aid.

articles.title: Moscow says Kyiv has struck a nuclear power plant as Ukraine marks independence day
articles.description: Russia has accused Ukraine of launching drone attacks that resulted in a fire at a nuclear power plant located in the Kursk region. The incident occurred as Ukraine was celebrating its Independence Day. According to Russian officials, the fire has been extinguished and radiation levels remain normal.

articles.title: Declaration of famine in Gaza lays bare Israel's disregard for humanitarian duty
articles.description: The formal declaration of famine in Gaza by the Integrated Food Security Phase Classification (IPC) is a significant development in the ongoing conflict. This article argues that the declaration highlights a failure to protect civilians and uphold humanitarian law, criticizing the blockades and the response of the international community to the crisis.

articles.title: Trump ran on a promise of revenge. He's making good on it
articles.description: Fulfilling his campaign promises, Donald Trump appears to be utilizing the powers of the government to take action against his political adversaries. Recent events, including an FBI search of former national security adviser John Bolton's home and investigations into Democratic officials, are presented as evidence of this retribution.

articles.title: Three people confirmed to have died in crash during flying lesson
articles.description: A helicopter crash on the Isle of Wight has resulted in the death of three people, with a fourth person hospitalized in serious condition. The helicopter was operated by Northumbria Helicopters and was conducting a flying lesson with four people on board, including the pilot, when it crashed near Ventnor.

articles.title: Doctors want women to know the nuanced reality of hormone therapy for menopause
articles.description: Medical professionals are emphasizing the importance of understanding the complexities of hormone therapy for menopause. While it can be an effective treatment for symptoms like hot flashes and night sweats, the decision to use it should be individualized, considering a woman's health history and risk factors for conditions such as blood clots, stroke, and breast cancer.

articles.title: Government is a constitutional employer not a market player, it cannot use outsourcing as a means of exploitation: Supreme Court
articles.description: The Supreme Court of India has ruled that public institutions cannot use outsourcing as a way to exploit workers by denying them regularization or fair pay. The court emphasized that the government, as a 'constitutional employer,' has a higher responsibility than a private employer and cannot cite financial constraints to justify precarious employment for perennial work.

articles.title: U.S. gets ready to impose additional tariffs on India from August 27, issues official notification
articles.description: The United States government is preparing to implement an additional 25% tariff on goods imported from India, with the new regulations set to take effect on August 27. The Department of Homeland Security has uploaded the official notification for these new tariffs.

articles.title: Trump says he's firing Fed Governor Lisa Cook, opening new front in fight for central bank control
articles.description: President Donald Trump has announced his intention to fire Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook, a move that is being seen as an escalation in his efforts to assert more control over the nation's central bank, which has traditionally operated with a degree of independence.

articles.title: Israeli strikes on Gaza hospital kill at least 20, including journalists
articles.description: Israeli airstrikes on a hospital in Gaza have resulted in the deaths of at least 20 people. Among the casualties were several journalists, according to reports from the scene. This event marks a significant escalation in the ongoing conflict.

articles.title: Two dead and 20 wounded in Minneapolis Catholic school shooting with suspect also dead
articles.description: A shooting at Annunciation Catholic School in Minneapolis has resulted in the deaths of two children, with at least 20 others injured. The suspected shooter is also deceased. The incident has prompted a massive police response and drawn national attention.

articles.title: India Reels at Trump's Highest Tariffs Yet
articles.description: The United States has imposed a 50% tariff on Indian goods, a move by President Trump intended to punish India for its purchase of Russian oil. This has significantly strained the once-positive trade and diplomatic relations between the two nations.

articles.title: Denmark summons U.S. envoy over report people linked to Trump trying to foment dissent in Greenland
articles.description: The Danish government has summoned the U.S. ambassador in response to reports that individuals connected to former President Donald Trump are attempting to encourage secessionist movements in Greenland. This has caused diplomatic friction between the two countries.

articles.title: 2 children killed, 17 injured in Minneapolis Catholic school shooting
articles.description: A shooter opened fire during morning Mass at Annunciation Catholic School in Minneapolis, killing two children, aged eight and 10, and injuring 17 other people. The suspect, identified as a 23-year-old former student, died from a self-inflicted gunshot wound. The FBI is investigating the attack as an act of domestic terrorism and a hate crime targeting Catholics.

articles.title: CDC Director Susan Monarez fired after refusing to resign, lawyers say she's not leaving
articles.description: The White House has fired Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Director Susan Monarez after she refused to resign. Her lawyers contend that she has not officially been terminated and will not leave her post. The move comes amid reported disagreements over vaccine policy and has led to the resignation of other senior CDC officials.

articles.title: âAlligator Alcatrazâ immigration detention center to be emptied
articles.description: The controversial immigration detention facility in Florida known as 'Alligator Alcatraz' is being emptied of detainees. This follows a federal judge's order for the facility to be dismantled. The Department of Homeland Security is transferring the detainees to other locations.

articles.title: Former Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe arrested over alleged fund misuse
articles.description: Sri Lanka's former President, Ranil Wickremesinghe, was arrested in connection with the alleged misuse of state funds during his time in office. A court denied him bail and he has been remanded until August 26, after which he was moved to a prison hospital.

articles.title: CBI books Anil Ambani's RCOM for â¹2,000-crore bank fraud, searches premises
articles.description: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has filed a case against Reliance Communications (RCOM) and its promoter, Anil Ambani, for an alleged bank fraud that resulted in a loss of over â¹2,000 crore to the State Bank of India. The agency conducted searches at Anil Ambani's residence and other premises linked to RCOM.

articles.title: End of US low-value package tariff exemption is permanent, Trump officials say
articles.description: The United States has ended the 'de minimis' rule that allowed packages valued at $800 or less to be imported free of tariffs. The move is expected to increase costs for shippers and consumers and has led to some international retailers canceling orders for US shoppers.

articles.title: U.S. appeals court finds Trump's global tariffs illegal, but leaves them in place now
articles.description: A U.S. federal appeals court on Friday ruled that most of President Donald Trump's tariffs on a wide range of trading partners were illegal. However, the court has allowed them to remain in place for now, giving the administration time to appeal the decision to the Supreme Court. [3]

articles.title: US revokes visas of Palestinian president and other officials ahead of UN General Assembly
