A parliamentary panel retains provisions allowing tax officials to access social media and private emails. The Bombay High Court acquits all 12 accused in the 7/11 Mumbai train blasts case. Opposition MPs submit notice in Rajya Sabha for removal of Justice Varma.

articles.title: PBS News Weekend full episode - July 20, 2025
articles.description: Israel's military issues new evacuation orders for central Gaza as more than 80 Palestinians are killed trying to get food aid. Thousands of lead pipes are removed from Flint, Michigan. Malaysia stops accepting plastic waste from the U.S. The rise of mental health misinformation on social media is also discussed.

articles.title: Israeli Tanks & Snipers Kill 79 Palestinians at Aid Site in Northern Gaza
articles.description: Israeli forces killed at least 115 Palestinians on Sunday, including 92 people who died while seeking aid. In the deadliest incident, Israeli troops massacred at least 79 people at the Zikim crossing in northern Gaza, where Palestinians gathered to wait for aid trucks. The UN agency stated that the crowd came under fire from Israeli tanks, snipers, and other gunfire as the convoy approached. Al-Shifa Hospital in Gaza City reported being overwhelmed with victims shot by Israel.

articles.title: Bangladesh Air Force training aircraft crashes into school in Dhaka, killing 16
articles.description: A Bangladesh Air Force training aircraft crashed into a school building in Dhaka, resulting in 16 fatalities, predominantly children, and injuring dozens. The incident occurred in the Uttara area of Dhaka, impacting the Milestone School and College campus.

articles.title: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar resigns citing medical issues
articles.description: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar resigned from his post on July 21, 2025, citing medical reasons. The Union Home Ministry issued a gazette notification of his resignation on July 22, 2025, less than 24 hours after he submitted it. Prime Minister Narendra Modi acknowledged the resignation on social media, wishing him good health.

articles.title: Ozzy Osbourne, Black Sabbath frontman and heavy metal legend, dies at 76
articles.description: Ozzy Osbourne, the iconic frontman of Black Sabbath and a pioneering figure in heavy metal music, has passed away at the age of 76. His family confirmed his death, remembering him as a beloved figure who battled various health challenges throughout his life.

articles.title: Trump accuses Obama of treason in escalating attacks over 2016 Russia probe
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump has accused former President Barack Obama of "treason," alleging without evidence that Obama led an effort to falsely link Trump to Russia and undermine his 2016 presidential campaign. Obama's office called the accusations "outrageous."

articles.title: DOJ seeks interview with Epstein's convicted associate Ghislane Maxwell
articles.description: The Department of Justice (DOJ) has announced its intention to seek an interview with Ghislane Maxwell, the convicted associate of Jeffrey Epstein. Maxwell is currently serving a 20-year prison sentence.

articles.title: Trump Announces Trade Deal with Japan, Imposing 15% Tariff
articles.description: President Donald Trump announced a trade framework with Japan, including a 15% tariff on goods imported from the nation. He stated the deal would create hundreds of thousands of jobs and maintain a strong relationship between the U.S. and Japan. [1, 2, 3, 6]

articles.title: Humanitarian Organizations Demand End to Gaza Siege Amidst Spreading Starvation
articles.description: Over 100 humanitarian organizations are calling for an end to Israel's siege of Gaza, warning of widespread starvation. They report increasing illnesses, empty markets, and people collapsing from hunger and dehydration, with the Palestinian Ministry of Health stating at least 111 starvation-related deaths. [2, 3, 14]

articles.title: Bryan Kohberger Sentenced to Life in Prison for University of Idaho Murders
articles.description: Bryan Kohberger has been sentenced to life in prison without parole for the murders of four University of Idaho students. Victims' families delivered emotional statements in court before his sentencing. [7, 9, 15]

articles.title: Wrestling legend Hulk Hogan dies at 71
articles.description: The iconic professional wrestler Hulk Hogan has passed away at the age of 71. His death was reported to be due to cardiac arrest, and an investigation is underway. Hogan was a major figure in the world of professional wrestling, known for his larger-than-life persona and catchphrases.

articles.title: France to recognize Palestine as a state, says Macron
articles.description: French President Emmanuel Macron announced that France will recognize Palestine as a state, amidst growing international concern over the humanitarian crisis in Gaza. This decision comes as reports indicate widespread starvation among the population in Gaza.

articles.title: US cuts short Gaza ceasefire talks, blames Hamas
articles.description: The United States has ended ceasefire talks in Qatar, stating that Hamas's latest response indicates a lack of willingness to reach a truce. This comes as reports highlight a severe humanitarian crisis in Gaza, with children reportedly starving to death.

articles.title: Top Story with Tom Llamas - July 25 | NBC News NOW
articles.description: A Southwest plane in California descended minutes into the flight to avoid a collision, a manhunt is underway after a deadly shooting at the University of New Mexico, and millions of Americans are facing severe weather from coast to coast. President Trump also commented on pardoning Ghislaine Maxwell and the ongoing situation in Gaza.

articles.title: Top news of the day: PM Modi, Maldives President Muizzu hold talks to boost ties; Cambodia backs ceasefire proposal to resolve conflict with Thailand, and more
articles.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi held talks with Maldivian President Mohamed Muizzu to strengthen cooperation in trade, defense, and infrastructure. Meanwhile, Thailand warned of potential war with Cambodia following deadly border clashes that have displaced over 130,000 people.

articles.title: Catch Me Up: Daily news roundup for July 25, 2025
articles.description: This daily news roundup covers top stories from the Bay Area, including San Mateo County Sheriff Christina Corpus calling for open proceedings, healthcare worker strikes in San Francisco and the East Bay, and discussions on new funding for regional transit. It also highlights the plight of a historic lighthouse seeking funds for repairs.

articles.title: Six killed in Haridwar Mansa Devi temple stampede
articles.description: At least six people died and at least two dozen were injured in a stampede at Haridwar's Mansa Devi temple on Sunday, July 27, 2025. The stampede occurred after rumors of an electric shock to a devotee caused panic.

articles.title: Israel announces military pause in three Gaza areas to address surging hunger
articles.description: The Israeli military announced on Sunday, July 27, 2025, that it would pause fighting in three populated areas of Gaza for 10 hours a day and open secure routes for aid delivery to address a surge in hunger.

articles.title: Russia scales down celebrations honouring its navy as Ukraine launches more drone attacks
articles.description: Russia scaled down its Navy Day celebrations on Sunday, July 27, 2025, citing security concerns due to ongoing Ukrainian drone attacks. Parades in St. Petersburg, Kaliningrad, and Vladivostok were cancelled.

articles.title: Israel announces military pause in three Gaza areas to address surging hunger
articles.description: The Israeli military announced it would pause fighting in three populated areas of Gaza for 10 hours a day and open secure routes for aid delivery to address a surge in hunger in the territory. This comes amid international criticism of Israel's conduct in the 21-month war.

articles.title: U.S. President Donald Trump announced a new trade deal with the European Union (EU)
articles.description: President Donald Trump announced a new trade deal with the European Union, setting a 15 percent tariff on most European imports to the U.S. The deal comes as the Trump administration faces criticism for not delivering on promises of '90 deals in 90 days'.

articles.title: Six killed in Haridwar Mansa Devi temple stampede
articles.description: At least six people died and two dozen were injured in a stampede at Haridwar's Mansa Devi temple. Police suspect rumors of an electric shock caused panic, leading to the stampede.

articles.title: 2 children killed at Miami sailing camp after barge collides with their boat, authorities say
articles.description: A barge collided with a sailboat carrying five children and an adult in Miami's Biscayne Bay, resulting in the deaths of two young children. Rescue divers searched the waters for survivors.

articles.title: Gunman kills 4, including police officer, in shooting at New York City office tower
articles.description: A gunman opened fire in a New York City office tower, killing four people, including a police officer. The shooter's motive and the full extent of the casualties are still being determined.

articles.title: 147 Palestinians Starve to Death; Netanyahu Denies Starvation in Gaza
articles.description: Health officials in Gaza report at least 147 Palestinians have starved to death, including 88 children. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu denies that starvation is occurring in Gaza.

articles.title: Gunman Kills 5 People in Midtown Manhattan Skyscraper, Including Himself
articles.description: A gunman opened fire in a Midtown Manhattan skyscraper, killing four people before taking his own life. The shooter, identified as 27-year-old Shane Tamura from Las Vegas, had a history of mental health issues and referenced CTE in a suicide note. The attack occurred in a building that housed NFL offices, and the shooter may have targeted them.

articles.title: Global Hunger Monitor Warns Israel's Siege on Gaza Has Led to âWorst-Case Scenario of Famineâ
articles.description: A UN-backed hunger monitoring group has warned of a "worst-case scenario of famine" in Gaza due to Israel's siege, with widespread starvation and malnutrition driving a rise in hunger-related deaths. The Integrated Food Security Phase Classification states that unimpeded, large-scale humanitarian aid is crucial to prevent further deaths. President Trump has acknowledged seeing images of starving children in Gaza, breaking from Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu's denial of starvation.

articles.title: UK to Recognize Palestinian State Unless Israel Agrees to Ceasefire
articles.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer announced that the UK will recognize a Palestinian state if Israel does not commit to ending the war in Gaza. This statement comes as aid trucks continue to enter Gaza and humanitarian airdrops are permitted, though aid groups state it is insufficient.

articles.title: Massive earthquake off Russia's coast triggers tsunami warnings across the Pacific Rim
articles.description: An 8.8-magnitude earthquake struck off Russia's coast, triggering tsunami warnings across the Pacific. Hawaii braced for the worst, with evacuations and gridlock reported as residents sought higher ground. Tsunami alerts were issued as far away as South America.

articles.title: Canada to recognize Palestinian state in September
articles.description: Canada announced its intention to recognize a Palestinian state at the UN General Assembly in September, citing the intolerable level of human suffering in Gaza. This move comes amid growing international pressure on Israel.

articles.title: Scores killed in Gaza as Trump says Hamas surrender is 'fastest way to end humanitarian crisis'
articles.description: The Hamas-run health ministry in Gaza reported that at least 111 Palestinians were killed in the past 24 hours, with many of them seeking aid. President Trump stated that Hamas's surrender and release of hostages is the quickest way to resolve the humanitarian crisis.

articles.title: Trump Sets New Tariff Rates, Shifts Timeline In Latest Trade Twist
articles.description: President Trump unveiled sweeping tariffs on dozens of countries late Thursday, shifting timelines to clinch agreements. He announced a new deadline of August 7 for steep tariffs on more than 60 countries, giving officials more time to implement them while extending the runway for the White House to land more deals.

articles.title: Kyiv mourns after deadliest attack in a year kills 31 people in Ukraine, including 5 children
articles.description: Kyiv is mourning after the deadliest attack in a year, which killed 31 people, including 5 children. The attack involved Russian missile strikes.

articles.title: Prajwal Revanna, former JD(S) MP, convicted in rape case
articles.description: Prajwal Revanna, former Janata Dal (Secular) MP, has been convicted in a rape case by a Special Court. This is the first case in which the trial has been completed, out of three rape cases and one sexual harassment case against him.

articles.title: Trump fires labor statistics chief after disappointing job numbers
articles.description: President Trump has fired the head of the Bureau of Labor Statistics following a worse-than-expected jobs report. The move comes as the economy shows signs of weakening, with job gains dwindling and inflation rising.

articles.title: Ghislaine Maxwell moved to Texas prison camp
articles.description: Ghislaine Maxwell, convicted of sex trafficking, has been moved from a Florida facility to a minimum-security women-only prison camp in Texas. The move has drawn criticism from victims' families who view it as preferential treatment.

articles.title: 51 Palestinians Seeking Aid Massacred at Zikim Crossing in Gaza
articles.description: Officials in Gaza report that Israeli forces killed at least 51 Palestinians who were seeking aid at the Zikim crossing. The incident is part of a broader pattern of violence where hundreds have been killed and injured while trying to access humanitarian assistance.

articles.title: Ukrainian drone attack sets Russian oil depot on fire as Zelenskyy announces prisoner exchange
articles.description: An overnight Ukrainian drone attack on an oil depot near Russia's Black Sea resort of Sochi sparked a major fire, Russian officials said on Sunday (August 3, 2025), as the two countries traded strikes and the Ukrainian President announced a prisoner exchange. [1, 11]

articles.title: 2024 Lok Sabha polls were 'rigged' and we will prove it, alleges Rahul Gandhi
articles.description: In a no-holds-barred attack on the Election Commission of India (ECI) on Saturday (August 2, 2025), Leader of Opposition (LoP) in the Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi alleged that the 2024 Lok Sabha elections were rigged and claimed that the Congress party suspects anywhere between 70 and 100 seats were manipulated. [2]

articles.title: Manhunt for mass shooting suspect in Anaconda Montana
articles.description: Melissa Adan reporting on the urgent manhunt for an army veteran accused of shooting and killing four people in Montana. [9]
articles.source: ABC World News Tonight with David Muir

articles.title: Explosive wildfires raging across the West; Consumers brace for more tariff uncertainty; Growing battle over Texas redistricting plan
articles.description: Dozens of wildfires are burning across the West, fueled by heat and dry conditions, leading to evacuations in several states. Meanwhile, new tariffs are set to take effect, raising concerns about increased costs for consumers. In Texas, a redistricting plan is causing political battles as Democrats leave the state to delay a vote.

articles.title: Texas Democrats flee state to block Trump-backed redistricting vote in dramatic legislative move
articles.description: Texas Democrats have left the state to prevent a vote on new congressional maps that Republicans believe will give them an advantage. This move has sparked a significant political confrontation.

articles.title: Ukrainian drone attack sets Russian oil depot on fire as Zelenskyy announces prisoner exchange
articles.description: An overnight Ukrainian drone attack targeted an oil depot near Sochi, Russia, causing a large fire. This incident occurred as Ukrainian President Zelenskyy announced a prisoner exchange between the two nations.

articles.title: Trump says he will 'substantially' raise tariffs on India over Russian oil purchases; 'unjustified and unreasonable', says New Delhi
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump on Monday (August 4, 2025) once again raised the issue of India buying oil from Russia and profiting from it. He stated that he would be âsubstantiallyâ raising the tariff âpaid by India to the USAâ. India hit back, calling the move 'unjustified and unreasonable'.

articles.title: At least four killed, several feared washed away in Uttarkashi cloudburst
articles.description: A cloudburst in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district on Tuesday (August 5, 2025) killed at least four people and several others are feared missing. Many houses were swept away by the raging waters, videos shared on social media showed.

articles.title: Texas Democrats who left state prevent vote, for now, on Trump's efforts to add GOP House seats
articles.description: Texas Democrats who left the state to prevent a vote on a redrawn congressional map sought by President Donald Trump have returned, but the immediate threat of losing their quorum has passed for now. The standoff highlights the ongoing political battles shaping the state's representation in Congress.

articles.title: Top news of the day: One body recovered, 190 people rescued after Uttarkashi flood; discussion on SIR not permitted in Lok Sabha, says Rijiju, and more
articles.description: Rescuers have retrieved one body in flood-hit Uttarakashi, where flash floods triggered by torrential rain hit the Kheer Ganga river. Union Minister Kiren Rijiju asserted that a discussion on the Special Intensive Revision exercise in Bihar cannot take place in the Lok Sabha as the matter is pending before the Supreme Court. Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated Kartavya Bhavan, the first of ten upcoming Common Central Secretariat buildings.

articles.title: Top news of the day | August 5, 2025
articles.description: A cloudburst in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district killed at least four people and several others are feared missing. Russia accused the United States of exerting illegal trade pressure on India after U.S. President Donald Trump threatened again to raise tariffs on India over its purchases of Russian oil. U.S President Donald Trump said India has not been a good trading partner and announced that he will raise the tariffs on India âvery substantiallyâ over the next 24 hours.

articles.title: This Morning's Top Headlines â Aug. 5 | Morning News NOW
articles.description: New York suffers from a layer of haze from widespread Canadian wildfires. Dozens of Texas Democrats protest Republican-led efforts to redraw congressional maps. Attorney General Pam Bondi orders a jury probe of Obama-administration officials over allegations of interference in the 2016 election.

articles.title: Five soldiers shot and wounded by Army sergeant at Fort Stewart, officials say
articles.description: An Army sergeant opened fire at Fort Stewart in Georgia, shooting five soldiers and prompting a brief lockdown at one of the country's largest Army bases, officials said. The alleged shooter is in custody.

articles.title: Trump plans to meet Putin, Zelenskyy as soon as next week, NYT reports
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump plans to meet in person with Russian President Vladimir Putin as early as next week, the New York Times reported on Wednesday, citing two people familiar with the plan. Mr. Trump then plans to meet with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

articles.title: Top 4 news stories you need to know: August 6, 2025
articles.description: FOX 35's John Brown and Garrett Wymer break down the top news stories of the day, from the shooting of five US Army soldiers at Fort Stewart in Georgia to a tandem bike rollercoaster making its first-ever US stop in Central Florida.

articles.title: Top 4 news stories you need to know: August 7, 2025
articles.description: FOX 35's Garrett Wymer and Marlisa Goldsmith break down the top news stories of the day, including a federal judge's injunction pausing construction at Alligator Alcatraz, Israel's announcement of wanting control of Gaza, President Donald Trump ordering a new census, a bond hearing for a suspected killer, and Florida officials trying to stop a Dengue fever outbreak.

articles.title: Top U.S. & World Headlines â August 7, 2025
articles.description: President Trump is threatening to deploy the National Guard to Washington D.C. and take over the city's police department. Five soldiers were wounded in an attack at Fort Stewart, Georgia. Republican Congressman Mike Flood faced backlash during a town hall. Tariffs on over 90 countries took effect, with President Trump imposing high rates on India and Brazil. President Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin may meet next week to discuss the war in Ukraine. A top UN official warned of catastrophic consequences for Israel's plans in Gaza. Israeli settlers attacked aid convoys, and Israeli attacks killed Palestinians. Doctors Without Borders called for the closure of US-backed aid centers in Gaza.

articles.title: Top Story with Tom Llamas - Aug. 7 | NBC News NOW
articles.description: President Trump's tariffs are in full effect for dozens of countries, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's announcement to take over Gaza has been met with backlash, and Instagram has a new feature allowing users to check friends' locations.

articles.title: Officer killed responding to shooting at Atlanta CDC identified
articles.description: David Rose, 33, was shot to death in a confrontation with a gunman near the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention headquarters in Atlanta. The gunman was later found dead in a nearby building.

articles.title: Trump plans to meet Putin on Ukraine; reportedly orders military to target drug cartels
articles.description: President Trump is planning to meet with Russian President Vladimir Putin in Alaska to discuss ending the war in Ukraine. Separately, reports indicate Trump has ordered the military to target drug cartels.

articles.title: Three people injured in shooting at Times Square
articles.description: Three people were injured in a shooting in Times Square, New York City, early Saturday morning. The suspect has been taken into custody.

articles.title: Active Shooter Reported Around Emory University
articles.description: Georgia authorities identify suspect in shooting near Emory University. The Georgia Bureau of Investigation on Saturday identified the gunman as 30-year-old Patrick Joseph White, of Kennesaw, Georgia. A police officer was killed in the incident.

articles.title: Wildfires Rage in Atlantic Canada as Extreme Heat Grips the Region
articles.description: Wildfires are burning out of control in Newfoundland and Labrador, with almost 3,000 individuals under an evacuation order. New Brunswick has also implemented restrictions to keep people safe amid high temperatures, low humidity, and elevated winds.

articles.title: Trump-Putin Summit in Alaska: India Welcomes Talks Amidst Russia-Ukraine Conflict
articles.description: India has welcomed the upcoming summit between US President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin in Alaska, viewing it as a potential step towards ending the Russia-Ukraine conflict. The summit is scheduled for August 15.

articles.title: Top news of the day | August 11, 2025
articles.description: Opposition leaders including Rahul Gandhi detained while taking out march against 'vote theft'; Centre pushes six bills without debate, and more. The major news headlines of the day and more.

articles.title: AP Top Stories August 11
articles.description: Here's the latest for Monday, August 11th: Netanyahu defends new Gaza offensive; Australia to recognize Palestinian state; Putin sticks to Ukraine demands ahead of planned Trump summit; Flooding in six Midwestern states.

articles.title: Five top headlines for Monday, Aug. 11, 2025
articles.description: Jefferson Humphreys has a quick look at the top headlines on CTV Morning Live Calgary for Monday, Aug. 11, 2025.

articles.title: Trump seizes control of D.C. police and deploys National Guard
articles.description: President Trump has taken control of the D.C. police and deployed National Guard troops, leading to warnings from mayors about potential power grabs.

articles.title: Shooter kills 3 in a Target parking lot in Austin, Texas, before being captured, police say
articles.description: A shooting at a Target store in Austin, Texas, resulted in three fatalities. The suspect is in custody.

articles.title: Israel intensifies bombing of Gaza killing 89 within 24 hours
articles.description: Israel has intensified its bombing campaign in Gaza, resulting in 89 deaths within a 24-hour period.

articles.title: Five More Palestinians Starve to Death in Gaza as Israeli Attacks Kill 89 in a Day
articles.description: Palestinian health officials report that Israeli attacks have resulted in at least 89 deaths across Gaza in the past day, with 31 fatalities occurring while people were seeking food. The attacks include a strike on a tent sheltering displaced civilians in al-Mawasi, which Israel had designated a "safe zone." Meanwhile, Israel's blockade has led to five more deaths from famine and malnutrition in the last 24 hours, bringing the total starvation deaths to 227.

articles.title: Wildfires scorch Greece as heatwave grips parts of Europe
articles.description: Greece is experiencing its most severe wildfire season, with dozens of new blazes erupting daily, exacerbated by strong winds, prolonged dryness, and intense heat. This has led to evacuations and dramatic rescue operations. Similar conditions are affecting other parts of Southern Europe, with reports of deaths in Spain, Montenegro, and Albania due to wildfires and heatstroke. Italy has placed eleven cities on red alert.

articles.title: Trump's Takeover: ACLU on Federalizing D.C. Police & Deploying 800 National Guard
articles.description: The ACLU is commenting on President Trump's actions regarding the federalization of D.C. police and the deployment of 800 National Guard troops. The report also touches on the racist roots of Trump's D.C. takeover and the broader implications for governance.

articles.title: Trump warns of 'very severe consequences' if Putin continues Ukraine war
articles.description: President Trump has warned Russia of "very severe consequences" if they do not agree to end the war with Ukraine, just hours before his meeting with President Putin.

articles.title: Deadly storms hammer parts of the U.S., millions bracing for severe weather
articles.description: Millions of Americans are bracing for severe weather as Tropical Storm Erin intensifies, following deadly storms that have already caused widespread damage and displacement.

articles.title: Supreme Court orders ECI to publish list of names excluded from Bihar draft roll
articles.description: The Supreme Court has ordered the Election Commission of India to publish a searchable list of approximately 65 lakh names excluded from the draft electoral roll in Bihar, along with the reasons for their non-inclusion.

articles.title: Top Story with Tom Llamas - August 14 | NBC News NOW
articles.description: President Trump is expected to meet with Russian President Vladimir Putin in Alaska, protesters clash with National Guard troops in Washington, D.C., and California Governor Gavin Newsom announces plans to â¦

articles.title: Top News Headlines of August 14, 2025 | 'Be the president of peace', released Hamas hostages urge Donald Trump to end war in Gaza
articles.description: Top News Headlines of August 14, 2025 | 'Be the president of peace', released Hamas hostages urge Donald Trump to end war in Gaza. Catch up on the latest news of the day.

articles.title: ABC World News Tonight with David Muir Full Broadcast - Aug. 14, 2025
articles.description: Mary Bruce reports from Anchorage, Alaska, on the eve of the high-stakes summit as Pres. Trump says he believed Russian Pres. Putin âwill make peace" with Ukraine, while Putin praises the administration's "energetic and sincere" efforts to end the war; Matt Gutman has details on the group of heavily armed border patrol agents that conducted an immigration raid outside the venue as Gov. Gavin Newsom announced his plan to have voters approve a new redistricting map in California; Victor Oquendo reports on the newly released body camera video showing neighborhood heroes rescuing a family of four from a small plane that crashed in a residential community in Pembroke Pines, Florida last month; and more on tonight's broadcast of World News Tonight with David Muir.

articles.title: Trump, Putin Meet in Alaska for High-Stakes Summit on Ukraine War
articles.description: President Donald Trump met with Russian President Vladimir Putin in Anchorage, Alaska, for a summit focused on the war in Ukraine. The meeting, which lasted less than three hours, did not result in a clear breakthrough or agreement on a ceasefire, with both leaders stating that more work is needed. Putin emphasized the need to address the 'primary causes' of the conflict for a lasting resolution, while Trump expressed hope for future discussions. The summit also saw discussions on potential US investment in Intel and other economic matters.

articles.title: No Deal Reached at Trump-Putin Summit in Alaska; Focus on Ukraine War
articles.description: The highly anticipated summit between President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin in Alaska concluded without a definitive agreement to end the war in Ukraine. While both leaders engaged in discussions and presented a cordial front, they acknowledged that key issues remain unresolved. Putin stressed the importance of addressing the root causes of the conflict, while Trump indicated a willingness for further dialogue. The summit also touched upon broader geopolitical and economic topics.

articles.title: Top News Stories You Need to Know: August 15, 2025
articles.description: Key news events from August 15, 2025, include President Trump's summit with Russian President Vladimir Putin in Alaska, Hurricane Erin strengthening in the Atlantic, and ICE detaining individuals after a traffic stop in Central Florida. Orlando's Magical Dining event also kicked off.

articles.title: PM Modi inaugurates two highways in Delhi
articles.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the Delhi section of the Dwarka Expressway and Urban Extension Road-II (UER-II), built at the cost of nearly â¹11,000 crore to reduce traffic congestion in the national capital and its surrounding areas. [1]

articles.title: Hurricane Erin explodes in strength to a Category 5 storm in the Caribbean
articles.description: Hurricane Erin exploded in strength to a Category 5 storm in the Caribbean on Saturday, rapidly powering up from a tropical storm in a single day, the National Hurricane Center said. [3]

articles.title: Protesters go on strike in Israel demanding ceasefire, release of Gaza hostages
articles.description: Protesters in Israel demanding the government make a deal to secure the release of hostages held by militants in Gaza escalated their campaign on Sunday (August 17, 2025), staging a nationwide strike that blocked traffic and closed businesses. [1]

articles.title: Zelenskyy, European leaders strategize ahead of Trump meeting in Washington
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, along with several European leaders, is set to meet with U.S. President Donald Trump in Washington on Monday, August 18, 2025. The meeting aims to discuss a peace deal for the war in Ukraine, with concerns that Trump might pressure Kyiv into a settlement favorable to Moscow. Zelenskyy previously met with European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen in Brussels.

articles.title: Top news of the day: INDIA bloc considering impeachment motion against CEC Gyanesh Kumar; after Putin, Trump set to meet Zelenskyy, and more
articles.description: Key news headlines for August 18, 2025, include the INDIA bloc considering an impeachment motion against Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar. Additionally, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and European leaders are scheduled to meet with U.S. President Donald Trump in Washington to discuss a peace deal, amidst concerns about potential pressure on Kyiv.

articles.title: Hurricane Erin forecast to create dangerous surf, high winds along US coast
articles.description: Hurricane Erin, currently a Category 4 storm, is expected to intensify and move north, potentially impacting the East Coast with dangerous rip currents and high waves. Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands are assessing damage from the storm. North Carolina has issued a state of emergency for the Outer Banks and a mandatory evacuation for Hatteras Island.

articles.title: Trump welcomes Zelenskyy to White House for talks on ending Russia's war in Ukraine
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy met with U.S. President Donald Trump at the White House to discuss ending the war in Ukraine. European leaders also attended the meeting, aiming to bolster Ukraine's negotiating position. Trump stated that Russia wants peace and that he is arranging a meeting between Putin and Zelenskyy.

articles.title: Top News Headlines of August 18, 2025
articles.description: Key headlines include astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla meeting PM Modi, ongoing protests in Parliament regarding Bihar electoral rolls, and Hamas approving a Gaza ceasefire proposal. The article also notes that Zelenskyy's attire for his meeting with Trump was pre-approved.

articles.title: Top news of the day: INDIA bloc considering impeachment motion against CEC Gyanesh Kumar; after Putin, Trump set to meet Zelenskyy, and more
articles.description: The INDIA bloc is considering an impeachment motion against Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar. In international news, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and European leaders will meet U.S. President Donald Trump to discuss a peace deal for Ukraine. The Rajya Sabha passed The Indian Ports Bill, 2025.

articles.title: Top news of the day: Former Supreme Court judge Sudershan Reddy is Opposition's V-P candidate; India announces Asia Cup 2025 squad, Suryakumar Yadav named captain, and more
articles.description: The INDIA bloc has decided to commonly field retired Supreme Court judge B. Sudershan Reddy as the candidate for the upcoming Vice-President elections. India also announced its Asia Cup 2025 squad, with Suryakumar Yadav named captain and Shubman Gill as vice-captain.

articles.title: Hurricane Erin churns off Florida coast, prompting evacuations
articles.description: Hurricane Erin, a Category 2 storm, is moving up the Atlantic coastline, expected to produce life-threatening surf and rip currents from Florida to Canada. Tropical storm and storm surge warnings are in effect for parts of North Carolina's Outer Banks, with some areas ordering evacuations.

articles.title: President Trump pushes for direct talks between Russia and Ukraine
articles.description: President Trump is advocating for direct talks between Russian President Vladimir Putin and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, offering security guarantees for Ukraine but ruling out U.S. troops on the ground. The White House is pressing Russia for these talks amidst ongoing conflict.

articles.title: Appeals court throws out massive civil fraud penalty against President Donald Trump
articles.description: An appeals court has overturned a significant civil fraud penalty against former President Donald Trump, a major victory for the former president.

articles.title: UN declares famine in Gaza; 2 people starve to death in 24 hours
articles.description: A UN classification system has officially declared famine in Gaza, with over half a million Palestinians facing catastrophic conditions. Israel's Foreign Ministry has rejected the findings.

articles.title: FBI searches home of former Trump national security adviser John Bolton
articles.description: The FBI has searched the home of former Trump national security adviser John Bolton, focusing on whether he illegally possessed or shared classified information.

articles.title: Trump administration accuses George Mason University of illegally using race in faculty hiring
articles.description: The Trump administration has notified George Mason University President Gregory Washington that he has 10 days to accept a proposed resolution correcting his alleged violations of using race in faculty hiring.

articles.title: Tour bus rollover kills 5 on interstate highway in western New York
articles.description: A tour bus carrying 52 people crashed on an interstate highway in western New York, resulting in five fatalities. The bus was en route from Niagara Falls to New York City when the driver lost control.

articles.title: FBI searches home and office of ex-Trump national security adviser John Bolton
articles.description: The FBI has searched the home and office of former national security adviser John Bolton as part of an investigation into classified materials. The search warrant was reportedly obtained with intelligence provided by the CIA director.

articles.title: Top news of the day: SIT arrests complainant for perjury in Dharmasthala case; CBI books Anil Ambani's RCOM for â¹2,000-crore bank fraud, searches premises, and more.
articles.description: The CBI has filed a case against Reliance Communications and its promoter director, Anil Ambani, for an alleged bank fraud that caused a loss of over â¹2,000 crore to State Bank of India. In other news, Jaishankar hits out at U.S. tariffs, saying India will not compromise on farmers' interests, and the Postal Department suspends bookings to the U.S. from August 25. Additionally, TMC leaders claim aggressive Ravneet Singh Bittu pushed Abu Taher in Lok Sabha, and a 'suspicious looking' man was apprehended from outside Parliament House.

articles.title: AP top stories August 23
articles.description: Michael Cohen has blunt advice for John Bolton after the FBI raid on his home, stating that the president has "crossed yet another name off of his enemies list." Donald Trump made an extreme claim about Pam Bondi, calling her his "embattled attorney general." Canadian Prime Minister Carney discussed Canada's role in security guarantees with Ukraine and planned meetings with German business leaders.

articles.title: Top News Headlines of August 23, 2025 | Pune couple dies after liver transplant surgery, Sahyadri Hospital says all medical protocols followed.
articles.description: A Pune couple died after liver transplant surgery, with Sahyadri Hospital stating that all medical protocols were followed. In other news, United States President Donald Trump nominated Sergio Gor as the new US ambassador to India, a move that comes as India-US ties have worsened due to planned tariffs. Uttarakhand experienced sudden floods and debris flows in Chamoli district, leaving at least two people missing.

articles.title: Vietnam starts mass evacuations, shuts airports as Typhoon Kajiki approaches
articles.description: Vietnam has shut down airports, closed schools, and initiated mass evacuations as it prepares for the most powerful storm so far this year. Typhoon Kajiki was packing winds of up to 166 kph (103 mph) as it approached Vietnam's central coast and was forecast to grow stronger before making landfall on Monday afternoon, the country's weather agency said.

articles.title: Multiple journalists killed by Israeli strikes on Gaza hospital
articles.description: Four journalists were among at least eight people killed on Monday (August 25, 2025) in a strike on a hospital in southern Gaza, including a freelancer who worked for the Associated Press. Mariam Dagga, 33, freelanced for the AP since the Gaza war began, as well as other news outlets.

articles.title: Wildfires threaten homes in Oregon and California, prompting hundreds of evacuations
articles.description: Wildfires threaten homes in Oregon and California, prompting hundreds of evacuations. The so-called picket fire is roaring through Northern California's wine country scorching more than 6,500 acres the flames casting an orange smoky hue over the skies. As more people have been forced to leave their homes in central Oregon the flat fire exploding in size overnight burning more than 21,000 acres thousands of homes there threatened the heat bearing down on the West.
articles.source: ABC World News Tonight with David Muir

articles.title: Israel condemned for Gaza hospital strikes that killed journalists
articles.description: International outrage is piling on Israel after two airstrikes on a Gaza hospital killed five journalists. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu calls it a "tragic mishap." Mike Armstrong explains how an alarming number of journalists have been killed in Gaza during Israel's war and how humanitarian law experts say this latest attack is a war crime. [4]

articles.title: Top Story with Tom Llamas - Aug. 25 | NBC News NOW
articles.description: Five journalists were among those killed by an Israeli strike at a Gaza hospital, President Trump suggests sending National Guard troops to Chicago, and Hurricane Katrina marks twenty years since the devastating catastrophe. [1]

articles.title: Top news of the day: U.S. issues notification for additional tariffs on India from August 27; PM Modi flags off Maruti Suzuki's 1st electric vehicle e-Vitara
articles.description: Top news of the day: U.S. issues notification for additional tariffs on India from August 27; PM Modi flags off Maruti Suzuki's 1st electric vehicle e-Vitara. The major news headlines of the day and more. [3]

articles.title: Top News Headlines of August 26, 2025
articles.description: The United States has announced plans to implement 50% tariffs on products imported from India, effective August 27. This follows a previous 25% tariff penalty on India for purchasing Russian oil. Additionally, the Supreme Court has ordered a Special Investigation Team (SIT) to probe the Vantara wildlife center in Gujarat.

articles.title: Three More Palestinians Starve to Death in Gaza as Israeli Forces Kill 75 in a Day
articles.description: Over the past 24 hours, three more Palestinians have died of starvation in Gaza, bringing the total to 303. Israeli forces killed at least 75 Palestinians, including 17 seeking food, on Monday. Press freedom groups are criticizing Israel for a strike on Nasser Hospital that killed 21 people, including five journalists.

articles.title: Cabinet approves India's 2030 CWG bid; U.S. 50% tariff on Indian goods in effect
articles.description: The Union Cabinet has approved India's bid to host the 2030 Commonwealth Games in Ahmedabad. Meanwhile, the U.S. 50% tariff on Indian goods is now in effect. The Israeli military continues operations around Gaza City, while President Trump is preparing to host a meeting on post-war plans for the territory.

articles.title: Top News Headlines of August 28, 2025
articles.description: Key headlines include India and Canada appointing new high commissioners, the US imposing 50% tariffs on Indian goods, and security forces foiling a terror infiltration attempt in Jammu and Kashmir.

articles.title: Top news of the day: PM Modi holds summit talks with his Japanese counterpart Ishiba in Tokyo; Mukesh Ambani says Jio to IPO in 2026, and more
articles.description: News highlights from August 29, 2025, include Qatar's interest in a trade pact with India, the Thai Prime Minister's dismissal, Mukesh Ambani's announcement about Jio's IPO, and a clash between BJP and Congress workers in Patna.

articles.title: Top U.S. & World Headlines â August 28, 2025
articles.description: This news roundup covers a deadly Russian missile and drone attack on Kyiv, Israeli military actions in Gaza, a school shooting in Minneapolis, and discussions about potential US-Russia deals involving ExxonMobil.

articles.title: Deadly Minneapolis School Shooting
articles.description: A shooting at a Minneapolis Catholic school during morning mass has left two children dead and 18 injured. The investigation is ongoing, with police reviewing surveillance footage and witness accounts. The father of one of the child victims spoke out about his loss.

articles.title: Trump's Global Tariffs Ruled Illegal by Appeals Court
articles.description: A federal appeals court has ruled that most of President Trump's global tariffs are illegal, finding he exceeded his authority. However, the court has allowed the tariffs to remain in place for now.

articles.title: "Trump Is Dead" Trends on X After JD Vance's Remarks Fuel Health Speculation
articles.description: The phrase "Trump is dead" trended on social media platform X, fueled by remarks from Vice President JD Vance and a resurfaced clip from The Simpsons. While White House officials state President Trump is in excellent health, the trend highlights public speculation about his well-being.

articles.title: PM Modi lands in China after seven years; to meet Xi, Putin
articles.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived in Tianjin, China, to attend the Shanghai Cooperation Organization (SCO) summit. He is scheduled to hold bilateral meetings with Chinese President Xi Jinping and Russian President Vladimir Putin. The discussions are expected to cover regional security, economic cooperation, and global issues. Modi and Xi are also set to discuss the long-standing border dispute between India and China.

articles.title: At least 3 killed, over 90 injured after passenger train derails in Egypt
articles.description: A passenger train derailed in western Egypt, killing at least three people and injuring 94 others. The train was traveling to Cairo from the Matrouh province when seven of its wagons went off the tracks, with two overturning. An investigation is underway to determine the cause of the accident, which is the latest in a series of rail crashes in Egypt.

articles.title: Chicago's mayor prepares for Trump's troops, a court rules Trump's tariffs are illegal
articles.description: Chicago's mayor has signed an executive order instructing city police and departments not to cooperate with any troop deployment to the city. This comes as a federal appeals court ruled that President Trump could not unilaterally implement most of his massive tariffs on imports, stating that the power to impose tariffs is vested in the legislative branch. Trump has indicated he will appeal the decision.

articles.title: Afghanistan earthquake: More than 800 dead, thousands injured
articles.description: A powerful earthquake struck eastern Afghanistan, destroying villages and killing over 800 people, with thousands more injured. The quake was felt in neighboring Pakistan as well.

articles.title: Rudy Giuliani injured in New Hampshire car crash
articles.description: Former New York City Mayor Rudy Giuliani was hospitalized after his car was struck from behind on a highway in New Hampshire. He reportedly fractured a vertebra.

articles.title: China's Xi Jinping criticizes 'bullying behavior' at Shanghai summit
articles.description: Chinese leader Xi Jinping urged leaders at the Shanghai Cooperation Organization summit to "seek integration, not decoupling" and "unequivocally oppose power politics," in a veiled criticism of U.S. influence.

articles.title: Over 800 killed, 2,500 injured as strong earthquake and multiple aftershocks strike Afghanistan
articles.description: A massive rescue operation was underway in Afghanistan on Monday, September 1, 2025, after a strong earthquake and multiple aftershocks flattened homes in a remote, mountainous region, killing more than 800 people, the Taliban authorities said. [1]

articles.title: Top News Headlines of September 1, 2025 | Calcutta HC puts interim stay on sale of a portion of Alipore Zoo
articles.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi redefined the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) as Security, Connectivity and Opportunity, and raised the terrorist attack in Pahalgam. The Calcutta High Court also put an interim stay on the sale of a portion of Alipore Zoo. [2]

articles.title: Global News Morning September 2, 2025
articles.description: The death toll from the Afghanistan earthquake surpasses 1,400. The program also covers other top news, including Israel committing genocide in Gaza according to world scholars, and labor strikes surging in Canada. [8]

articles.title: Top News Headlines Today: September 3, 2025
articles.description: Key headlines include Prime Minister Modi unveiling India's first semiconductor chip, the Yamuna River crossing a danger mark in Delhi, and a suicide bombing in Quetta, Pakistan. Other news includes a court rejecting bail for Umar Khalid and Sharjeel Imam in the 2020 Delhi riots case, and UPI reaching a record 20 billion transactions in August.

articles.title: This Morning's Top Headlines â Sept. 3
articles.description: A federal appeals court blocked the Trump administration's effort to deport alleged Venezuelan gang members. President Trump announced a US strike on a vessel in the Caribbean carrying drugs from Venezuela. The House committee investigating Jeffrey Epstein released more files related to the case.

articles.title: Top news of the day: September 3, 2025
articles.description: Opposition-ruled states argued in the Supreme Court that Governors have no role in lawmaking. Russia launched over 500 drones and missiles at Ukraine overnight. The Bombay High Court asked activist Manoj Jarange Patil to clarify his role in damages during the Maratha quota stir.

articles.description: Nineteen days after a British F-35B stealth fighter jet made an unscheduled landing at Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram International Airport, the state-of-the-art aircraft remains grounded.

articles.description: Over 25 crore workers from government sectors such as banking, postal services, mining, construction, and transport will go on a nationwide general strike, or Bharat Bandh, on Wednesday, July 9.

articles.title: Man Dies After Getting Sucked Into Plane Engine At Milan Airport
articles.description: A man was sucked into an aircraft engine on the taxiway at Milan Bergamo Airport in Italy on Tuesday morning.

articles.description: Tomy and Shiny, a Kerala-based couple, used to run 'A&A Chits and Finance', a chit fund institution offering high returns, ranging between 15 to 20 per cent on investments.

articles.description: BTS' Suga quietly donated â©5 billion and helped design a music-based therapy program for autistic children. Fans worldwide joined in, raising â©200 million within hours to support the Min Yoongi Treatment Centre.

articles.description: A father heroically jumped off a Disney cruise ship to save his daughter who fell overboard from the fourth deck. The incident occurred as the ship was returning to Fort Lauderdale, Florida, after a four-day cruise through the Bahamas.

articles.description: Country music icon Dolly Parton announced a $1 million donation to the Mountain Ways Foundation to aid victims of Hurricane Helene.

articles.title: Garth Brooks Accused of Rape in Lawsuit
articles.description: A hair and makeup artist alleges that country music star Garth Brooks raped her five years ago in a Los Angeles hotel; Brooks denies the claims.

articles.title: Bruce Springsteen Endorses Harris, Condemns Trump
articles.description: Rock star Bruce Springsteen publicly endorses Kamala Harris and criticizes Donald Trump, stating he should be disqualified from presidency.

articles.title: Kotak Mahindra Bank branch manager siphoned off Rs 31 crore of public money to gamble; Know how he misused customerâs KYC details

He forged signatures on government cheques and laundered the money through foreign gaming apps. To avoid detection, he misused customers' KYC details like Aadhaar to open 21 accounts, implicating unwitting individuals.

articles.title: Cierra Ortega removed from Love Island USA after racist posts spark outrage: This is what she said
articles.description: Cierra Ortega was swiftly removed from Love Island USA Season 7 after racist social media posts resurfaced, including anti-Asian slurs used in 2015 and 2020. The backlash was immediate, with Ortega losing nearly 200,000 Instagram followers. Producers acted quickly, citing unacceptable language, leaving her partner Nic Vansteenberghe single and reigniting debates about contestant vetting.

articles.title: CIA radios and yak butter, and hours to spare: How a 23-year-old monk outwitted the Dragon empire
articles.description: In 1959, the 14th Dalai Lama, disguised as a soldier, slipped out of Lhasa under the nose of the Chinese army. An ominous invitation to watch a dance without guards pushed Tibetâs spiritual leader to flee across the Himalayas. Sheltered by India, he built a new Tibetan home in exile. This is the real story of that cold, desperate escape, Nehruâs gamble, and the defiance that still shapes Tibetâs struggle for identity and freedom.

articles.title: Tripura Teen Goes Missing In Delhi, Chief Minister Manik Saha Intervenes
articles.description: Sneha, a student of Atma Ram Sanatan Dharma College, Delhi University, was last in contact with her family on July 7.

articles.title: Massive Fire Erupts On Goods Train Carrying Diesel In Tamil Nadu
articles.description: A major fire broke out on four wagons of a goods train carrying diesel near the Tiruvallur railway station around 5:30 am this morning, triggering panic in the surrounding areas.

articles.title: "Just Release Epstein Files": Elon Musk Doubles Down After Trump Post
articles.description: Billionaire Elon Musk asked his former ally and US President, Donald Trump, to just release the case files related to sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, as promised.

articles.title: Mourning begins in Texas where more than 170 are still missing from flash floods
articles.description: In Texas, at least 120 people have died from flash floods, with over 170 still missing. The search for victims continues along extensive riverbanks and debris. The floods forced families to make urgent escapes, and recovery efforts are hindered by heat and debris.

articles.title: Trump announces 30% tariffs against EU, Mexico to begin August 1
articles.description: President Donald Trump has announced 30% tariffs on imports from the European Union and Mexico, set to begin on August 1. This move is part of his broader strategy to address trade imbalances and revive the U.S. economy.

articles.title: Guatemalan villagers lynch 5 men accused of robbing homes after earthquakes
articles.description: In Guatemala, residents of Santa Maria de Jesus lynched five men accused of robbing homes damaged by recent earthquakes. The community, still lacking electricity and potable water, took matters into their own hands amid the crisis.

articles.title: Kotak Mahindra Bank branch manager siphoned off Rs 31 crore of public money to gamble; Know how he misused customerâs KYC details
articles.description: A Kotak Mahindra Bank branch manager in Bihar stole over Rs 31 crore of public funds to fuel his gambling addiction. He forged signatures on government cheques and laundered the money through foreign gaming apps. To avoid detection, he misused customers' KYC details like Aadhaar to open 21 accounts, implicating unwitting individuals.

articles.title: Cierra Ortega removed from Love Island USA after racist posts spark outrage: This is what she said
articles.description: Cierra Ortega was swiftly removed from Love Island USA Season 7 after racist social media posts resurfaced, including anti-Asian slurs used in 2015 and 2020. The backlash was immediate, with Ortega losing nearly 200,000 Instagram followers. Producers acted quickly, citing unacceptable language, leaving her partner Nic Vansteenberghe single and reigniting debates about contestant vetting.

articles.title: CIA radios and yak butter, and hours to spare: How a 23-year-old monk outwitted the Dragon empire
articles.description: In 1959, the 14th Dalai Lama, disguised as a soldier, slipped out of Lhasa under the nose of the Chinese army. An ominous invitation to watch a dance without guards pushed Tibetâs spiritual leader to flee across the Himalayas. Sheltered by India, he built a new Tibetan home in exile. This is the real story of that cold, desperate escape, Nehruâs gamble, and the defiance that still shapes Tibetâs struggle for identity and freedom.

articles.title: China Racing to Stop Population From Plunging to World War II Levels
articles.description: China's central government plans to offer parents a cash subsidy of up to $1,500 per child to reverse the country's declining birth rate. Analysts remain skeptical about the effectiveness of this measure, warning that the population could reach levels not seen since World War II by the end of the century.

articles.title: VA Treats PTSD with Risky Drug Cocktails, Affecting Hundreds of Thousands
articles.description: Hundreds of thousands of veterans with PTSD have been prescribed simultaneous doses of powerful psychiatric drugs, a practice known as 'polypharmacy.' This approach can lead to severe side effects, including increased suicidal thoughts, despite VA guidelines advising against such combinations.

articles.title: Trump Targets China's Tariff Workaround with New 40% Levy on Transshipments
articles.description: President Trump imposed a 40% tariff on transshipments, aiming to curb Chinese companies' practice of routing goods through other countries to bypass U.S. tariffs. This move targets indirect imports contributing to the $1.2 trillion U.S. trade deficit.

articles.title: Climate Summit Agrees on Global Carbon Tax
articles.description: World leaders reached a landmark agreement to implement a global carbon tax by 2030 to combat climate change.

articles.title: Former Indian MP Sentenced to Life in Prison for Raping His Domestic Worker
articles.description: Prajwal Revanna, a former Indian MP and grandson of a former prime minister, was sentenced to life imprisonment for the rape of his domestic worker.

articles.title: SpaceX Launches First Mars Colony Module
articles.description: SpaceX successfully deployed the first module of a planned permanent Mars colony, marking a significant step in space exploration.

articles.title: China and Russia Begin Joint Military Drills in Sea of Japan
articles.description: China and Russia have commenced joint naval exercises in the Sea of Japan, aiming to strengthen their partnership and counterbalance the U.S.-led global order. The drills, named Joint Sea-2025, include submarine rescue, anti-submarine, air defense, and maritime combat operations.

articles.title: Thousands Join Pro-Palestinian March Over Sydney Harbour Bridge
articles.description: Tens of thousands marched across the Sydney Harbour Bridge, demanding recognition of Palestinian statehood and sanctions on Israel. Despite severe weather, the protest remained peaceful with no reported injuries or arrests.

articles.title: OPEC+ Agrees to a Big Output Increase
articles.description: The oil-producing alliance OPEC+ has approved a production hike of 547,000 barrels per day starting in September, reversing recent cuts aimed at regaining global market share amid geopolitical strain.

articles.title: Trump Fires Head of Bureau of Labor Statistics Over Weaker-Than-Expected Jobs Report
articles.description: President Trump dismissed Erika McEntarfer, head of the Bureau of Labor Statistics, following the release of a disappointing jobs report. Trump alleged the numbers were 'RIGGED' to make him look bad, though he provided no evidence. The firing has drawn widespread criticism, with former Treasury Secretary Lawrence Summers warning it signals a move toward authoritarianism.

articles.title: Texas Democrats Flee State to Block GOP Redistricting Plan Backed by Trump
articles.description: In an effort to prevent the passage of a Republican-backed redistricting plan, Texas Democrats have left the state, effectively stalling the legislative process. Governor Greg Abbott has threatened to expel the absent lawmakers if they do not return, accusing them of abandoning their duties.

articles.title: Metaâs AI Shows Signs of Self-Improvement, Zuckerberg Says
articles.description: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced that the company's AI systems have begun demonstrating the ability to self-improve, marking a step toward superintelligence. Meta is intensifying its focus on AI, forming a superintelligence team by recruiting top talent from Apple, OpenAI, Google DeepMind, and Anthropic.

articles.description: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. announced the withdrawal of $500 million in funding for mRNA vaccines targeting diseases such as the flu and COVID-19, citing concerns that 'mRNA technology poses more risks than benefits for these respiratory viruses.'

articles.title: Texas Redistricting Fight Escalates into National Political Battle
articles.description: Republicans in Texas are attempting to create more safe U.S. House seats, prompting Democrats to counteract by redrawing district maps in blue states. Texas Governor Greg Abbott has filed a lawsuit to remove the state's House Democratic leader.

articles.title: House Republicans Subpoena Jeffrey Epstein Files
articles.description: House Republicans have issued a subpoena for files related to Jeffrey Epstein, demanding transparency over the late sex offender's case, despite recent moves by President Trump to mitigate public outrage.

articles.title: Israelâs Cabinet Approves Plan to Take Control of Gaza City
articles.description: Israel's Security Cabinet has approved a plan to take over Gaza City, marking another escalation of Israel's 22-month offensive. Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu stated that Israel plans to retake control of the entire territory and eventually hand it off to friendly Arab forces opposed to Hamas.

articles.title: President Trumpâs New Tariffs Take Effect, Potentially Raising Prices on Consumer Goods
articles.description: President Donald Trump's new tariffs on dozens of countries took effect overnight, potentially leading to price increases on a wide range of products, including coffee, clothing, and cars. Experts estimate that higher tariffs will cost the average household $2,400 a year.

articles.title: U.S. Aid Cuts Could Trigger Global Health Setbacks
articles.description: Global health aid is projected to fall to its lowest level in 15 years, with U.S. cuts playing a major role in the downturn. The United States slashed its global health funding by at least 67 percent in 2025 compared to last year, threatening essential health programs across low-income countries.

articles.description: Azerbaijan, Armenia, and the United States signed landmark agreements in Washington on August 8, advancing the South Caucasus peace process and opening a new chapter in U.S.âAzerbaijan relations.

articles.title: Trumpâs Tariffs Come Into Force
articles.description: The United States began imposing tariffs of 10% or higher on goods from more than 60 countries and the European Union on Thursday, leading to economic fallout with growth and job gains slowing and inflation ticking upward.

articles.title: Capacity Secures Massive Funding to Transform Contact Centers
articles.description: Capacity, the AI powerhouse transforming how businesses handle customer support, closed an impressive $92.6 million funding round, positioning itself at the forefront of contact center automation.

articles.description: President Trump's recent order targeting drug cartels has sparked concerns in Latin America about a potential return to U.S. military interventions reminiscent of the Monroe Doctrine era.

articles.title: Cannabis Poisonings Are Rising, Mostly Among Kids
articles.description: The proliferation of cannabis products like edibles has led to an increase in poisonings among children and teenagers, with symptoms ranging from seizures to severe respiratory issues.

articles.title: Heavy Rains in Wisconsin Lead to Flooding and Early Closure of State Fair
articles.description: Record-setting rainfall in the Milwaukee area caused severe flooding, prompting the early closure of the Wisconsin State Fair and raising concerns about infrastructure resilience.

articles.title: FBI Dispatches Agents to D.C. Streets as Trump Weighs Calling National Guard
articles.description: The Trump administration has assigned FBI agents to combat violent crimes in Washington, D.C., with President Donald Trump claiming crime is out of control, despite data indicating a decline.

articles.title: Five Al Jazeera Journalists Killed in Israeli Airstrike on Gaza
articles.description: An Israeli airstrike in Gaza City resulted in the deaths of five Al Jazeera journalists, including Anas al-Sharif. The IDF alleged al-Sharif was a Hamas operative, while press freedom advocates condemned the attack.

articles.title: Trump Considers Deploying National Guard Troops to DC
articles.description: President Trump is considering deploying National Guard troops to Washington, D.C., claiming a crime emergency despite data showing a decline in violent crime rates.

articles.title: Israeli Forces Kill 123 Palestinians in a Day Amid Campaign to Seize Gaza City
articles.description: Israeli forces have intensified their offensive in Gaza City, resulting in the deaths of at least 123 Palestinians and injuries to nearly 440 others over the past 24 hours. The operation aims to forcibly displace nearly 1 million Palestinians into camps further south.

articles.title: Trump Deploys National Guard to Washington D.C., Assumes Control of Police Force
articles.description: President Donald Trump has deployed 800 National Guard troops and 500 federal law enforcement agents to Washington D.C., placing the city's police department under direct federal control. The move has been criticized as an 'authoritarian push' and an 'intrusion on autonomy' by local officials.

articles.title: Global Markets Rally on Fed Rate Cut Hopes, Tariff Pause
articles.description: Global equity markets surged as investors reacted to softer-than-expected U.S. inflation data, renewed optimism for a Federal Reserve rate cut in September, and a 90-day pause on additional tariffs for Chinese imports announced by President Trump.

articles.title: Trump to Meet Putin in Alaska Summit
articles.description: President Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin are scheduled to meet in Anchorage, Alaska, to discuss a ceasefire in Ukraine and potential follow-up diplomacy involving Ukrainian President Zelenskyy. Trump has warned that Putin will face 'very severe consequences' if no peace deal is reached.

articles.title: Trump Seeks to Extend Federal Control over DC Police
articles.description: President Trump is preparing legislation to prolong federal oversight of Washington, D.C.'s Metropolitan Police Department beyond the 30-day limit. He has already mobilized National Guard troops and federal agents in the city to combat violent crime, though data shows D.C. crime is currently at a 30-year low.

articles.title: 27 Dead, Dozens Missing as Ships Carrying Asylum Seekers Sink Off Italian Coast
articles.description: Italyâs Coast Guard reports that at least 27 people have drowned and dozens remain missing after two ships carrying asylum seekers from Libya capsized off the Italian island of Lampedusa. About 60 survivors were rescued from the sea.

articles.title: Trump Meets Putin in Alaska with Future of Ukraine War Hanging in Balance
articles.description: President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin met in Anchorage, Alaska, to discuss the ongoing conflict in Ukraine. The summit concluded without a concrete deal or ceasefire, leaving the future of the war uncertain.

articles.title: Federal Authorities Target Homeless Camps in Washington as Trump's Takeover Continues
articles.description: Federal agents began clearing homeless encampments in Washington, D.C., as part of President Trump's expanded control over the city's law enforcement. The operation has sparked protests and raised concerns about the treatment of unhoused individuals.

articles.title: Florida Plans 'Deportation Depot' to Operate Alongside 'Alligator Alcatraz' ICE Jail
articles.description: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis announced plans to open a second immigration detention center, dubbed 'Deportation Depot,' at a state prison near Jacksonville. This move comes amid legal challenges to the existing 'Alligator Alcatraz' facility.

articles.title: Trump and Putin Meet in Alaska to Discuss Ukraine Conflict
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin met in Alaska to discuss the ongoing war in Ukraine but failed to reach an agreement on a ceasefire or broader peace deal.

articles.title: Hurricane Erin Strengthens into Category 5 Storm
articles.description: Hurricane Erin has intensified into a Category 5 storm, posing significant threats to coastal regions with potential for severe damage and flooding.

articles.title: AI-Generated Models Shake Up the Fashion Industry
articles.description: The rise of AI-generated models is transforming the fashion industry, raising questions about unrealistic beauty standards and the future role of human models.

articles.title: Trump signs big tax cut and spending bill into law in July Fourth ceremony
articles.description: President Donald Trump signed his sweeping tax cut and spending package, known as the "big, beautiful bill," into law during a July Fourth ceremony filled with patriotic symbolism.

articles.title: Deadly flooding catastrophe devastates Texas towns
articles.description: Devastating floods swept through parts of Texas along the Guadalupe River, resulting in at least 24 deaths and leaving 20 girls missing from a summer camp in the area.

articles.title: Hamas gives 'positive response' to Gaza ceasefire mediators
articles.description: Hamas announced that it had given a thumbs-up to the latest ceasefire proposal, but added that further talks were needed.

articles.title: Overnight News Digest: Science Saturday, 7/5/25
articles.description: Researchers have transformed a fungus long associated with death into a potential weapon against cancer. Aspergillus flavus, found in tombs like that of King Tut, was once feared for its deadly spores. Now, scientists at Penn and several partner institutions have extracted a new class of molecules from itâcalled asperigimycinsâthat show powerful effects against leukemia cells. These compounds, part of a rare group known as fungal RiPPs, were bioengineered for potency and appear to disrupt cancer cell division with high specificity.

articles.title: Todayâs Top Tech & AI News at a Glance â July 5, 2025
articles.description: A group of independent publishers has filed an antitrust complaint with the EU, alleging Googleâs AI-generated âAI Overviewsâ reduce traffic to original content and prevent publishers from opting out without losing search visibility. This challenge throws a spotlight on how AI features may weaken web publishers financiallyâand how regulators may step in to protect content creators.

articles.title: KCTV5's top headlines of Saturday, July 5, 2025
articles.description: A deadly wrong-way crash in Kansas City, Kansas, resulted in one death and five serious injuries, including three children. Additionally, an argument escalated to gunfire, leaving one man dead. The Stars and Stripes Picnic, Kansas City's official fireworks show, attracted thousands to the World War I Memorial.

articles.title: Israel launches airstrikes targeting Yemenâs Houthi rebels, and Houthis launch missile at Israel
articles.description: Israel's military conducted airstrikes on Houthi-controlled ports and facilities in Yemen, prompting retaliatory missile fire from the Houthis targeting Israel. This escalation follows an attack on a Liberian-flagged ship in the Red Sea, suspected to be carried out by the Houthis.

articles.title: UNAids chief âshaken and disgustedâ by US cuts that will mean millions more deaths
articles.description: Winnie Byanyima, executive director of UNAids, expressed deep concern over significant U.S. aid cuts, warning that if funding permanently disappears, the world could face an additional 6 million HIV infections and 4 million AIDS-related deaths by 2029.

articles.title: Weedkiller ingredient widely used in US can damage organs and gut bacteria, research shows
articles.description: New research indicates that diquat, a herbicide replacing glyphosate in some U.S. weedkillers, can harm gut bacteria and damage organs. Despite being banned in several countries due to its toxicity, the EPA has resisted calls for a ban in the U.S.

articles.title: Bharat Bandh On July 9: Who Called It, What's Open, What's Closed
articles.description: Over 25 crore workers from government sectors such as banking, postal services, mining, construction, and transport will go on a nationwide general strike, or Bharat Bandh, on Wednesday, July 9.

articles.title: Eknath Shinde's FOMO Moment As Thackerays Team Up Amid Marathi Language Row
articles.description: In a curious development during the Maharashtra Navnirman Sena's (MNS) protest in Thane amid the raging language row in the state, state Transport Minister and Shiv Sena leader Pratap Sarnaik tried to join the protest against the government

articles.title: Man Dies After Getting Sucked Into Plane Engine At Milan Airport
articles.description: A man was sucked into an aircraft engine on the taxiway at Milan Bergamo Airport in Italy on Tuesday morning.

articles.title: BTSâ Suga mobilises global ARMY to raise over 200 million won in 24 hours with one quiet, heartfelt gesture
articles.description: BTS member Suga donated â©5 billion and helped design a music-based therapy program for autistic children. Fans worldwide joined in, raising â©200 million within hours to support the Min Yoongi Treatment Centre.

articles.title: Heroic dad jumps off Disney cruise ship to save his daughter after she falls from 4th deck
articles.description: A father leaped off a Disney cruise ship to rescue his daughter who fell from the fourth deck. The incident occurred as the ship was returning to Fort Lauderdale, Florida, after a Bahamas cruise.

articles.title: Garth Brooks accused of rape in lawsuit

articles.title: Bruce Springsteen endorses Harris, condemns Trump

articles.title: Russia Attacks Ukraine as New Audio Reveals Candidate Trump Told Putin Heâd Bomb Moscow
articles.description: Russia launched a barrage of hundreds of drones and missiles at Ukraineâs capital overnight, killing at least two people and wounding 16 others. The attack sparked fires across Kyiv with damage to residences, vehicles, and warehouses. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky called the bombardment âa clear escalation of terrorâ by Moscow. Meanwhile, CNN has revealed that Donald Trump told a private gathering of wealthy donors last year that he once sought to deter Russian President Vladimir Putin from attacking Ukraine by threatening to âbomb the [blank] out of Moscowâ â though Trump used an expletive. The revelation came in audiotapes recorded at fundraisers in New York and Florida.

articles.title: Drilling Plummets Under Trump Despite 'Drill, Baby, Drill' Promise
articles.description: A slump in active oil and gas rigs across the United States has undercut President Trump's rallying cry to "drill, baby, drill," raising economic and political stakes for his administration. Despite Trump's aggressive push for domestic fossil fuel expansionâincluding an official declaration of a "national energy emergency" to fast-track drillingâthe U.S. rig count has now fallen to its lowest level in nearly four years, according to a report by Baker Hughes, the energy technology company. It showed that the rig count was 539 on July 3, down by 47 compared to this time last year. While the gap between Trump's promises and the drilling reality threatens to become a flashpoint in the energy debate, executives and analysts say that market forces lie at the heart of the rig decline: flagging oil prices, investor pressure for financial returns, and technological shifts that allow producers to extract more oil with fewer rigs.

articles.title: U.S. Sanctions Investigator of Palestinian Human Rights Abuses
articles.description: The United States has sanctioned an independent investigator of human rights abuses in the Palestinian territories, in the latest move by the Trump administration targeting critics of Israel's military campaign in Gaza.

articles.title: Trump threatens 35% tariffs on Canadian imports
articles.description: President Donald Trump has threatened to impose a 35% tariff on imports of goods from Canada, set to take effect on August 1. The stated reason for the tariff is Canadaâs alleged failure to stop fentanyl from entering the U.S.

articles.description: European NATO members, including the United Kingdom, France, and Italy, have projected naval power into the Indo-Pacific through aircraft carrier deployments, aiming to assist the U.S. in countering China's military buildup.

articles.title: Gen Z Homeowners Suffer Property Tax Shock

articles.description: President Joe Biden has decided to issue a pardon for his son Hunter, expected to be announced Sunday night, marking a reversal from his previous stance of not using executive authority to pardon his son or commute his sentence.

articles.description: A fast-moving wildfire destroyed 50 to 80 structures on the Grand Canyonâs North Rim, including the historic Grand Canyon Lodge. The blaze, which was started by lightning 10 days ago, rapidly grew to 7.8 square miles due to hot temperatures, low humidity, and strong wind gusts. According to park officials, the North Rim will remain closed for the rest of the season.

articles.title: World news of the day: 14 July, 2025
articles.description: The European Union has refrained from retaliatory tariffs against the United States despite President Donald Trump imposing a 30 percent tariff on imports from the European Union. The US tariffs on the EU will come into effect on 1 August, but the EU is still holding on to the hopes of a trade deal with the US.

articles.title: House Speaker Johnson Joins Republicans Pressing for Transparency on Epstein Case
