articles.description: Wall Street reached new record highs as strong U.S. economic data, including solid retail sales and a robust Philly Fed business index, boosted investor confidence. The Atlanta Fed's GDPNow model forecasts 2.4% Q2 growth, outperforming consensus expectations. Corporate earnings from United Airlines and PepsiCo also beat forecasts, reinforcing market optimism. Despite tensions from President Trump's repeated attacks on Fed Chair Jerome Powell, investors remained unfazed. Speculation about Powell's potential removal sparked minimal market reaction, reflecting investor skepticism or belief such changes are already priced in.

articles.title: World news of the day: 17 July, 2025
articles.description: South Korea's top court cleared Samsung Electronics chairman Jay Y. Lee of alleged accounting fraud and stock manipulation related to a $8 billion merger in 2015. The case involved the merger between two Samsung affiliates, Samsung C&T and Cheil Industries, which prosecutors had alleged was designed to consolidate Leeâs control of the tech giant. A lower court had also cleared him of the charges last year. Business lobby groups have welcomed the courtâs decision, calling it a 'stabilising development for the South Korean economy'.

articles.title: Overnight News Digest July 17th 2025
articles.description: A U.S. assessment found that American strikes destroyed only one of three Iranian nuclear sites. One of the three nuclear enrichment sites in Iran struck by the United States last month was mostly destroyed, setting work there back significantly. However, the two others were not as badly damaged and may have been degraded only to a point where nuclear enrichment could resume in the next several months if Iran wants it to, according to a recent U.S. assessment of the destruction caused by the military operation. The assessment was briefed to some U.S. lawmakers, Defense Department officials, and allied countries in recent days.

articles.title: Trump Seeks Release of Grand Jury Papers on Epstein

The confirmation vote was 51-47, along party lines.

articles.description: President Trump fired the head of the Bureau of Labor Statistics on Friday, hours after the agency released a weaker-than-expected jobs report. Trump wrote on social media that the numbers were 'RIGGED in order to make the Republicans, and ME, look bad.' Trump presented no evidence suggesting the numbers were rigged. Trump's firing of Erika McEntarfer was widely criticized. Former Treasury Secretary Lawrence Summers spoke to ABC on Sunday, stating, 'This is the stuff of democracies giving way to authoritarianism. Firing statisticians goes with threatening the heads of newspapers. It goes with launching assaults on universities. It goes with launching assaults on law firms.'

articles.title: Greg Abbott Threatens to Expel Texas Democrats as They Thwart Redistricting

This threat came after numerous Texas Democrats left their home state and traveled to Illinois in an effort to prevent the state legislature from holding a vote that would approve Republican-backed redistricting maps. Abbott said in his statement that the Texas Democrats' absences were 'premeditated for an illegitimate purpose... the specific purpose of abdicating the duties of their office and thwarting the chamber's business.' He added: 'This truancy ends now. The derelict Democrat House members must return to Texas and be in attendance when the House reconvenes at 3.00 p.m. on Monday.'

articles.description: A US federal appeals court ruled that the Trump administration can proceed with cuts to foreign assistance programs, overturning a lower court's decision that would have restored the funds.

articles.title: Protesters Demand Justice for Anas al-Sharif and Other Journalists Assassinated by Israel
articles.description: Worldwide protests and vigils are calling for accountability following the targeted assassination of Al Jazeera correspondent Anas al-Sharif and his colleagues by Israeli forces in Gaza City.

articles.title: 27 Dead, Dozens Missing as Ships Carrying Asylum Seekers Sink Off Italian Coast

About 60 survivors were rescued from the sea. Since 2014, over 32,000 people have died attempting to cross the Mediterranean to seek asylum in Europe, with over 700 deaths or disappearances so far this year alone.

Key topics include a ceasefire in Ukraine and potential follow-up diplomacy involving Ukrainian President Zelenskyy. Trump has warned that Putin will face "very severe consequences" if no peace deal is reached.

articles.title: Historic Flood in Milwaukee Declared a "1,000-Year Event"

articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin held a high-stakes meeting in Alaska to discuss the future of the war in Ukraine. The summit aimed to address the ongoing conflict, but no concrete agreements or ceasefires were established during the talks.

articles.title: Florida Plans 'Deportation Depot' Amid Legal Challenges to 'Alligator Alcatraz' ICE Jail

This facility is set to operate alongside the controversial 'Alligator Alcatraz' ICE jail, which is currently facing legal challenges over its conditions.

articles.title: U.S. Markets End Week on Mixed Note; Dow Flirts with Record as Fed Cut Bets Grow
articles.description: U.S. stock markets concluded the week with mixed results. The Dow Jones Industrial Average briefly reached a new intraday high, while the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite experienced pullbacks, influenced by investor sentiment regarding potential Federal Reserve interest rate cuts and weaker corporate guidance from key technology companies.

articles.title: Trump and Putin meet about Ukraine

articles.title: Sewage Floods Gaza Hospital After Israeli Strike, as Childhood Malnutrition Soars

articles.title: Flash floods in India and Pakistan kill over 280, scores still missing

articles.title: Massive LGBTQ+ turnout at banned Budapest Pride

articles.title: Yemen-launched missile intercepted en route to Israel
articles.description: Israeli defense forces reported intercepting a missile launched from Yemen on June 28, underscoring growing tensions fueled by Iran-aligned Houthi militant activity.

articles.title: China expands social safety net after devastating floods
articles.description: Following severe floods in Guizhou province, China has upgraded support systemsârelocating affected residents and enhancing rural livelihoods as part of a climate-adaptation push.

articles.title: Mediator Proposes $20 Million Settlement in Trumpâs CBS Lawsuit
articles.description: A mediator has suggested a $20 million settlement in President Donald Trumpâs lawsuit against Paramount Global, stemming from a '60 Minutes' interview with then-Vice President Kamala Harris. The proposed terms include a $17 million donation to a Trump-related foundation or museum, payment of legal fees, and public service announcements across Paramount-owned platforms to combat antisemitism. The lawsuit alleges defamation and biased editing by CBS.

articles.title: Massive LGBTQ+ Turnout at Banned Budapest Pride
articles.description: Despite authorities banning the event, tens of thousands attended Budapest Pride on June 28, signaling a sharp rise in protests against Hungaryâs restrictive government stance on civil rights.

articles.title: US-China Trade Tensions Escalate
articles.description: The US has imposed fresh curbs on AI chip exports and revoked hundreds of student visasâmoves that China calls a 'serious violation' of the Zurich trade truce. In response, China is planning 'firm countermeasures,' according to The Guardian. These developments are sparking fresh uncertainty across global markets.

articles.title: Supreme Courtâs Term Yields Triumphs for Trump
articles.description: The New York Times reports that the Supreme Court's recent term has resulted in significant victories for former President Donald Trump.

articles.title: Russia Presses Advantage in Troop Numbers as Front Line Expands
articles.description: The Wall Street Journal reports that Russia is leveraging its numerical superiority in troops to expand the front line in ongoing conflicts.

articles.title: IDF Pounds Gaza, Killing 60, as Ceasefire Talks Gain Momentum
articles.description: The Jerusalem Post reports that the Israel Defense Forces have conducted operations in Gaza resulting in 60 fatalities, coinciding with progressing ceasefire negotiations.

articles.title: Senate Passes President Trump's 'Big Beautiful Bill' Amidst Tense Session
articles.description: The Senate narrowly approved President Donald Trump's extensive tax and spending bill after a turbulent overnight session, with Vice President JD Vance casting the tie-breaking vote.

articles.title: Iran Threatens to Release 100GB of Trump Aides' Emails
articles.description: An Iran-linked hacking group has threatened to release a batch of emails it claims to have stolen from President Trump's longtime aides, including adviser Roger Stone and White House chief of staff Susie Wiles.

articles.description: A massive heat dome is bringing record temperatures to much of Europe, with forecasters warning of even more extreme heat in the coming days. Spain and Portugal recorded their hottest-ever June temperatures, while wildfires erupted in France and Turkey.

articles.title: Senate Narrowly Approves Massive Bill to Gut Social Programs and Cut Taxes on the Rich
articles.description: The U.S. Senate has passed a sweeping package of tax breaks for the wealthy and deep cuts to social programs, including Medicaid and food assistance, with Vice President JD Vance casting the tie-breaking vote.

articles.title: Russia Says Moscow Now Occupies All of Ukraineâs Luhansk Region
articles.description: A Russia-appointed official in Ukraineâs occupied Luhansk region claims that Moscow's forces have overrun the entire area, marking it as the first Ukrainian region fully occupied by Russia after more than three years of war.

articles.title: Stock Market News for Jul 2, 2025
articles.description: Wall Street closed mixed after a choppy session, with the Dow advancing while the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite finished in negative territory amid sector shifts and economic data releases.

articles.title: House Gives Trump a Win as His Big Tax Bill Overcomes Weeks of Tense Negotiations
articles.description: The House of Representatives passed President Trump's significant tax and spending bill after overcoming internal Republican disagreements. The bill includes extensive tax cuts and reductions to social programs like Medicaid.

articles.title: Israeli Strikes on Gaza Kill 300 Palestinians in 2 Days, Including Hospital Director
articles.description: Israeli military actions in Gaza have resulted in over 300 Palestinian deaths within 48 hours, including the director of Gazaâs Indonesian Hospital. The attacks have intensified the humanitarian crisis in the region.

articles.title: Trump Says Israel Agreed to Gaza Ceasefire
articles.description: President Trump announced that Israel has agreed to a 60-day ceasefire in Gaza and urged Hamas to support the agreement, aiming to de-escalate ongoing conflicts in the region.

articles.title: âFree Americaâ: Anti-Trump Administration Protests Planned Across U.S. on July 4
articles.description: On July 4, 2025, protests against President Donald Trump's administration are planned across the U.S., replacing traditional Independence Day celebrations for many. These demonstrations build on a series of prior protests since Trump's re-election, including the June 14 'No Kings' protests opposing perceived authoritarianism, and nationwide immigration protests sparked by increased ICE raids and the controversial deployment of federal military forces in states like California. Women's March has organized over 140 events for 'Free America Weekend,' calling attention to critical issues such as poverty, discrimination, and fear-based politics. Additional demonstrations, dubbed 'No Kings 2.0,' will focus on immigration justice and solidarity, emphasizing non-violent action in several states. Protests are also expected outside Trump's Mar-a-Lago residence, featuring symbolic acts like flying a baby Trump balloon. Moreover, The People's Union USA urges a nationwide boycott of corporate July 4 events, encouraging local support and community action to protest wealth inequality and social injustices. These events represent a significant continuation of public dissent against Trumpâs policies and perceived erosion of democratic freedoms.

articles.title: Seattle Named Second-Most Popular Fourth of July Domestic Travel Destination by AAA
articles.description: Seattle was ranked as the second-most popular domestic travel destination for the Fourth of July holiday this year, according to AAA. Seattle hotspots have seen notable crowds this week. Visitors at Pike Place Market shared their reasons for coming to Seattle, including hiking, escaping heat and humidity, and exploring the city before embarking on cruises.

articles.title: July 4, 2025: What Made Headlines Today
articles.description: A quick rundown of todayâs biggest news stories, including Russia launching 550 drones and missiles on Ukraine overnight, injuring 23 in Kyiv; President Trump planning to send tariff letters to multiple countries; and Hamas reviewing a final Gaza ceasefire deal as Israelâs ministers praise the war on Iran as a defining moment in the nationâs history.

articles.title: Death toll rises to 43 in Texas floods as rescuers scour for missing

articles.title: Court rulings favor Big Tech in AI copyright cases

articles.title: USMNT has one goal vs. Mexico in Gold Cup final: âLift a trophyâ

articles.title: Elon Musk Launches New Political Party Over Independence Day Weekend

articles.title: Texas Flooding Death Toll Surpasses 100 as Hope for Finding Survivors Fades

articles.title: Elon Musk Launches 'America Party,' Tesla Shares Decline

articles.title: President Trump Imposes Additional 10% Tariff on Countries Aligning with BRICS Policies

articles.title: Netanyahu and Trump Promote Plan to Expel Palestinians from Gaza

articles.title: Texas Floods Kill at Least 82 People, with Dozens Still Missing and More Rains Forecast
articles.description: Catastrophic flooding in central Texas has resulted in at least 82 deaths, with dozens still missing. The Guadalupe River's rapid rise led to significant casualties, including children from Camp Mystic.

articles.title: Trump Announces Steep Tariffs on 14 Countries

Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson dissented, calling the decision 'unfortunate, hubristic and senseless.'

articles.description: Unprecedented flash floods in Ruidoso, New Mexico, resulted in at least three deaths, including two children. In Texas, the death toll from recent floods has climbed to at least 109, with over 160 people still missing.

articles.title: Wall Street Rises as Tech, AI Lead the Charge

articles.title: June Heat Wave Killed 2,300 People Across 12 European Cities

articles.title: Trump Announces 35% Tariff on Canadian Imports

articles.title: Texas Floods Kill at Least 82 People, with Dozens Still Missing and More Rains Forecast

The floods forced families to make urgent escapes, and the community is now holding prayer services to mourn the losses.

articles.description: Global markets remained resilient despite U.S. President Donald Trump's announcement of a 30% tariff on most EU and Mexican imports starting August 1. European and Mexican markets showed minor declines, but broader investor sentiment held strong, with world equity indices rising and the Nasdaq reaching new highs.

articles.title: World news of the day: 14 July, 2025

articles.title: 5 things to know for July 14: Immigration, Gaza, Epstein files, Kentucky shooting, Texas flooding
articles.description: Key news highlights including inhumane conditions at a Florida immigration detention center, an Israeli strike killing children in Gaza, and a shooting spree in Lexington, Kentucky, leaving two dead and three injured.

articles.title: House Speaker Johnson joins growing number of Republicans pressing Trump administration for more transparency on Epstein case

articles.title: Amazon Web Services Cuts Hundreds of Jobs Amid AI Adoption

articles.title: Global Hack on Microsoft Product Hits U.S., State Agencies

articles.title: Trump Sues Wall Street Journal and Rupert Murdoch Over Epstein Report

articles.title: Earth spinning faster, AI companions, worldâs most powerful passports: Catch up on the dayâs stories
articles.description: A roundup of notable stories including Earth's accelerated rotation, the rise of AI companions among teens, and shifts in global passport rankings.

articles.title: The 7 things you need to know for Tuesday, July 22

articles.title: Nations Who Fail to Curb Fossil Fuels Could Be Ordered to Pay Reparations, Top UN Court Rules
articles.description: The International Court of Justice ruled that countries must prevent harm to the climate system, and failing to do so could result in them being ordered to pay compensation and make other forms of restitution.

articles.title: White House Cuts Artificial Intelligence Regulations to Compete with China
articles.description: The White House announced a reduction in artificial intelligence regulations in an effort to compete with China in a technological arms race.

articles.title: Israelâs Knesset Approves Motion to Annex Occupied West Bank
articles.description: Israel's Knesset has overwhelmingly approved a nonbinding motion to annex the occupied West Bank, drawing condemnation from the Palestinian Authority.

articles.title: World Court Rules States Have Obligation to Cut Emissions
articles.description: The International Court of Justice ruled that states are obligated to reduce greenhouse gas emissions to protect Earth's climate, and failing to do so may violate international law.

articles.title: Trump Administration to Strip EPA of Power to Combat Climate Crisis
articles.description: The Trump administration has drafted a plan to rescind the EPA's authority to regulate greenhouse gas emissions, aiming to overturn the 2009 endangerment finding.

articles.title: Wall Street Ends Week on a High Note - July 25, 2025
articles.description: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite reached record highs, driven by strong corporate earnings and optimism over potential trade agreements with the European Union and Asia-Pacific partners.

articles.title: The 7 things you need to know for Friday, July 25
articles.description: Key news highlights include the U.S. and Israel withdrawing from Gaza ceasefire talks, the IRS considering eliminating non-English language tax services, and the FCC approving the $8 billion Paramount-Skydance merger.

articles.title: July 25, 2025 â PBS News Hour full episode
articles.description: Coverage includes President Trump's executive order on homelessness, the politics behind the Paramount-Skydance merger, and potential financial gains for private companies from mass deportations.

articles.title: Gulf Stream Could Collapse as Early as 2025, Study Suggests
articles.description: A new study indicates that the Atlantic Meridional Overturning Circulation (Amoc), also known as the Gulf Stream system, could collapse as early as 2025 due to global heating. Such a collapse would have catastrophic climate impacts, including disrupted rainfall patterns, increased storms, and rising sea levels.

articles.title: EU Approves Regulations to Facilitate Electric Vehicle Travel and Reduce Emissions
articles.description: The Council of the EU has approved new regulations aimed at facilitating electric vehicle travel across Europe and reducing greenhouse gas emissions. The rules require the installation of fast charging stations every 60km along the EU's main highways by 2025, with a minimum power output of 150kW.

articles.title: European Companies Resort to Layoffs, Freezes Due to Inflation and Ukraine Conflict

articles.title: US and EU avert trade war with 15% tariff deal

The deal includes significant EU investments in the US and increased purchases of American energy and military equipment.

articles.title: Thousands in Greece and Turkey evacuate as winds and heat fan wildfires

articles.title: A 'random' stabbing at a Michigan Walmart left 11 injured, officials say. Here's what we know so far

articles.title: US Must Recognize Palestine Amid Gaza Starvation Horror, Says Jill Stein
articles.description: Jill Stein urges the U.S. to recognize a Palestinian state as Gaza faces severe starvation, following France's recent recognition.

articles.title: Trump Strikes EU Trade Deal for 15% Tariffs on Most Goods
articles.description: President Donald Trump announces a trade agreement with the European Union, imposing a 15% tariff on most European goods, including cars.

articles.title: Israel Introduces Limited Pause in Fighting to Allow Aid Delivery in Gaza

articles.title: Gunman Kills 5 People in Midtown Manhattan Skyscraper, Including Himself

The shooter was identified as 27-year-old Shane Tamura of Las Vegas, who reportedly drove across the U.S. to carry out the attack.

articles.title: Russian Airstrikes Hit Prison in Ukraine, Killing 17 People

A hospital in the Dnipro region was also hit, resulting in three deaths, including a pregnant woman. These attacks coincide with President Trump's shortened deadline for Russia to agree to a ceasefire.

articles.title: Trump Threatens India with Tariffs as High as 25%
articles.description: President Donald Trump threatened to raise tariffs on Indian imports up to 25% if a long-sought trade agreement isn't reached. He stated, 'They are going to pay 25%,' emphasizing the need for further negotiations between the two countries.

articles.title: 8.8-Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Russia's Far East, Sending Tsunami Waves Across Pacific
articles.description: An 8.8 magnitude earthquake struck Russiaâs far east early Wednesday, sending tsunami waves to Japan, Hawaii, and the U.S. West Coast. Initially, millions of people were in the path of the tsunami and were told to take steps to move away from the shore and seek higher ground. But no major damage has been reported so far.

articles.title: Canada Will Recognize Palestinian State at UN General Assembly: Carney

Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney made the announcement on Wednesday, explaining that Ottawa had hoped that a two-state solution could be achieved through a negotiated peace process, but that approach was 'no longer tenable.'

articles.title: Trump Hits India with 25% Tariff, Extra 'Penalty' for Russian Oil Purchases
articles.description: United States President Donald Trump has announced a 25 percent tariff on Indian goods, as well as an unspecified penalty for the countryâs purchase of Russian oil and military equipment, as the unending war in Ukraine frustrates the White House. Trump announced the trade moves on his Truth Social account on Wednesday, saying they are necessary to reverse a long-running trade imbalance.

articles.title: Trump Sets New Tariff Rates, Shifts Timeline In Latest Trade Twist
articles.description: President Trump announced sweeping tariffs on dozens of countries, setting a new deadline of August 7 for steep tariffs on more than 60 countries, aiming to press ahead with new levies and shift timelines to clinch agreements.

articles.title: China Racing to Stop Population From Plunging to World War II Levels
articles.description: China's central government plans to offer parents a cash subsidy of up to $1,500 per child to reverse the country's declining birth rate, with analysts skeptical about its effectiveness in encouraging more births.

articles.title: Extreme Weather Causes Flooding and Travel Disruptions in Northeast US
articles.description: Heavy storms dumped torrential rain on the mid-Atlantic and Northeast regions, causing flooding along the Interstate 95 corridor, stranding vehicles, and disrupting air travel with ground stops at major airports.

articles.title: VA Treats PTSD with Risky Drug Cocktails, Affecting Hundreds of Thousands
